story:
Long and Short..

Last September, ella & kai went in the studio and recorded 7 original songs, including our debut single, First & Last, which we released a few days before Christmas.

This coming March, ella & kai will celebrate our first birthday with the launch of our first full-length album. We would love to have your support and blessing in this process. 

When ella and kai started, we had no idea what our music would sound like apart from the knowledge that we were both separate artistes pursuing our own dreams the past 15 years. However, one thing we did know was that we wanted to play music together and through this journey, ella & kai have developed a unique sound through playing musical chairs in their songs. 

Making ella & kai a sustainable endeavour was to become another challenge, given our already busy lives and the geographic distance separating us, Kai in Singapore and Ella in Australia. Somehow we managed, endured and found ways to financially make this happen. Between March and December of 2016,  no less than 7 trips back and forth between Singapore and Melbourne allowed us to be in the same space to dream, to write and rehearse. This enabled us to cover quite a bit of ground in a short span of time even though we started off with nothing more than a resonance in our ideas and connection. 

So what you are supporting are not just pre-existing music and words casually captured in a recording studio performed by two skilled musicians; but more so, a duet who realises, recognises and wants to respond fully to our calling as music-messengers to inspire and to remind us all to live a little more fearlessly, a little more lovingly, a little more consciously.

We need all of your support so we can continue bringing this love far and wide. Your contribution will not only help us put out this album, it will also give us the courage and energy to keep doing what we do. And we can't do this on our own! We need your help!

Once the CDs are out, we will be donating 5% of our sales to Arts Reaching 4 Corners, an arts education initiative piloted by both ella and kai. This initiative was started because we believe in the power of music and the arts to affect change. We want to provide orphaned and underprivileged children around the world with access to free music and art classes, so that they can be empowered and inspired by the magic of the arts to dream, to hope and to believe that they can create a brighter future for themselves and the world.

What We Need & What You Get.....

We are asking you to help us raise at least $16,500, which will all go towards the total cost of producing the music and printing the physical CDs (see below for more detailed breakdown).

Anything extra will help us offset the cost of producing a couple of beautiful music videos, shot and directed by talented young Singaporean filmmaker, Stephanie Yan.

See below for the exact figure and breakdown for videography and photography which are both essential components in helping to promote our music to a wider audience.

 

Our Basic Budget Breakdown:

  • $14,500 for recording, mixing & mastering (Includes recording studio rental, studio engineer fees, mixing engineer fees, and mastering engineer fees) 
  • $2,000 for CD album art/design/production/packaging/printing
  • $10,000 for videography for music videos (includes equipment, shooting time, post production) and photography 

For our generous sponsors we've come up with a host of fun rewards...

  • Digital Download of our brand new album
  • Signed physical copy of the brand new album
  • Signature cotton reusable bag --Go green with us
  • Signed ella & kai poster  --fun way to show off your support, w/ logo
  • Concert in your home / corporate event
  • Lyric and Chord sheets of our songs
  • One-on-one lessons with either Ella or Kai on an instrument of your choice
  • Pair of tickets to one of our shows
  • Your very own song/s - ella & kai will write and record a song just for you
  • EK in education - A day of educational music outreach at your school

 

The Impact...

ella & kai is a unique collaboration between two global-minded musicians, who both left Singapore to travel, study, live and perform across continents. 20 years later, our journeys have come full circle and we meet back in Singapore where we first started and form this multi-instrumental duo where we "play musical chairs with each other" and call our music - Singapore soul-made folk.

Our original music draws inspiration from love and life's million little gifts, helping all to notice some of the inconspicuous and precious beauty of the world around us, telling stories about common people doing extraordinary things. 

Our hope is to share this album with all our friends and fans while picking up new listeners and friends along the way.  We are very appreciative of your support, in whatever form you choose.

Other Ways You Can Help...

If you cannot contribute at this time, we totally understand. Other ways you can help?

  • Get a digital copy of our single 'First and Last'  (available on CD Baby)
  • Come see us at one of our live shows
  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign via email or social media 
  • Share our music with your friends!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools

  • Direct people to our IndieGogo page

Thank you....

Thank you for sharing our journey with us! Your help and contribution will help take this project to the next level and enable us to share the gift of music all around! 

Ella and Kai xx
story_txt:
Long and Short..Last September, ella & kai went in the studio and recorded 7 original songs, including our debut single, First & Last, which we released a few days before Christmas.This coming March, ella & kai will celebrate our first birthday with the launch of our first full-length album. We would love to have your support and blessing in this process. When ella and kai started, we had no idea what our music would sound like apart from the knowledge that we were both separate artistes pursuing our own dreams the past 15 years. However, one thing we did know was that we wanted to play music together and through this journey, ella & kai have developed a unique sound through playing musical chairs in their songs. Making ella & kai a sustainable endeavour was to become another challenge, given our already busy lives and the geographic distance separating us, Kai in Singapore and Ella in Australia. Somehow we managed, endured and found ways to financially make this happen. Between March and December of 2016,  no less than 7 trips back and forth between Singapore and Melbourne allowed us to be in the same space to dream, to write and rehearse. This enabled us to cover quite a bit of ground in a short span of time even though we started off with nothing more than a resonance in our ideas and connection. So what you are supporting are not just pre-existing music and words casually captured in a recording studio performed by two skilled musicians; but more so, a duet who realises, recognises and wants to respond fully to our calling as music-messengers to inspire and to remind us all to live a little more fearlessly, a little more lovingly, a little more consciously.We need all of your support so we can continue bringing this love far and wide. Your contribution will not only help us put out this album, it will also give us the courage and energy to keep doing what we do. And we can't do this on our own! We need your help!Once the CDs are out, we will be donating 5% of our sales to Arts Reaching 4 Corners, an arts education initiative piloted by both ella and kai. This initiative was started because we believe in the power of music and the arts to affect change. We want to provide orphaned and underprivileged children around the world with access to free music and art classes, so that they can be empowered and inspired by the magic of the arts to dream, to hope and to believe that they can create a brighter future for themselves and the world.What We Need & What You Get.....We are asking you to help us raise at least $16,500, which will all go towards the total cost of producing the music and printing the physical CDs (see below for more detailed breakdown).Anything extra will help us offset the cost of producing a couple of beautiful music videos, shot and directed by talented young Singaporean filmmaker, Stephanie Yan.See below for the exact figure and breakdown for videography and photography which are both essential components in helping to promote our music to a wider audience. Our Basic Budget Breakdown:

Pair of tickets to one of our shows

EK in education - A day of educational music outreach at your school

story:
Our Story

We are Heavy HK and UMMU, the duo behind I Kong's first homecoming tour to China in 2018. Some of you might be familiar with our regular programming of soundsystem events in Hong Kong and China. Over time, we have shared alot of joy, sang of many dreams and sailed to many corners. 

From the first generation of Chinese migrants crossing the globe for Jamaica, Leslie Kong of Beverly's Records has planted a deep seed in Reggae music history. From Bob Marley’s first studio session to Toots & Maytals, Jimmy Cliff.. and many more.



I Kong, a revered elder and highly respected Reggae artiste. Along with his son, Skunga Kong, a highly acclaimed producer distinguished as “Young Legend” by pioneers, they are heirs to Leslie Kong’s Jamaica-Chinese legacy. With Heavy HK and UMMU, they stepped foot into China to share this unique heritage and thus, fulfilling a cycle of mankind’s journey. 



While in their Father's land, they spent a chemistry exploding week with JahWahZoo, Chengdu’s finest 7 piece Reggae band, as they prepared for their debut in Hong Kong's biggest festival - Clockenflap. The combination was a clear and dynamic hit!  

 



Catapulting us to this point, to create a historical Reggae album!

Legendary Jamaican Chinese Reggae icon... I Kong
Highly acclaimed young prodigy producer... Skunga Kong
Fans’ favourite Chinese Reggae band... JahWahZoo

 

A combination like none other, set in destiny!

 

What We Need?

We are aiming to raise 150,000HKD to facilitate the album production
This would include some of the following:

  • Recording Studio, Mastering, Printing, Pressing
  • Travel, Transport, Accommodation, Food
  • 6 intensive weeks of creating and recording in Chengdu
  • Handling and Transaction fees

 

The Impact

Music is about bringing people together. In Reggae, the message of 'Unity' is an overstanding. Coming from one blood, we are all Brothers and Sisters dispersed across this planet over time. As Bob Marley sings, “Movements of Jah People”. From one land to another.. I Kong and his story is a testament to this.

Reggae has recently been recognised as UNESCO as a global cultural treasure! With the recent induction of Jamaica's Reggae Gold Hall of Fame, Leslie Kong of Beverly Records was recognised for this formidable contributions in Jamaica’s music. From being the first to record Bob Marley, to producing Jimmy Cliff, Toots and The Maytals to being the co-founder of Island Records. He also played a big role in the soundtrack to “The Harder They Come”, starring Jimmy Cliff.

This incredible genre of music has touched every corner and in China, it is at a developing stage. We do not share the same commercial support, compared to pop music or other genres. It is magnificent to see the legacy of music and humanity go one round across the world and back. From Leslie Kong leaving China to Jamaica and having I Kong step foot for the first time in China to introduce all these heritage.

As the musical heir of Beverly Records’ Leslie Kong, I Kong is a bonafide icon, whose identity of being half Jamaican and half Chinese has delivered him as a messenger. In 2019, Heavy HK took on the mammoth task of a Homecoming Tour with I Kong and his son/protege, Skunga Kong. It was their first trip to his Father’s land and connected with China popular Reggae band, JahWahZoo. Through a week long of intensive rehearsals, they turned up the heat and was straight fyah.

Naturally, on his coming visit, I Kong, as a Teacher figure will spend time in China with JahWahZoo to make an album together. Passing on the knowledge through music, as prophesied in his lyrics "Pass It On", to the people of his father's homeland. This album will be produced by Skunga Kong, 3rd generation Chinese Jamaican musical pride continuing Beverly's Records' legacy.

Musical Journeys like this are historical and become a part of legendary tales passed on to generations. To Reggae lovers worldwide, Overseas Chinese or Chinese Reggae fans, this may call to your heartstrings.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you can help and be part of this!

  • Spread the word! Share the link with your friends and loved ones.
  • Due to high handling fees, we are open to direct donations too. 
    Contact us directly at hello.ummu@gmail.com or heavyhkc@gmail.com

Follow the journey and cheer us on!

Click on to check our works online...

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Project

Regional Rhythms is an interactive music submission project that allows members of the community to submit original music samples to an online portal, which are then collaged into full-length songs exploring the diverse music of the Midwest Region.

Your Contributions

How funding can help this project grow:

  • A big aspect of this project was traveling and immersing ourselves in the unique music scenes throughout the Midwest. Funding allows these trips to be possible and keep our crew exploring new places.  
  • Once this portion is completed, we hope to be able to enter this project in festivals all around the country. Your contributions will help cover entry and attendance fees. 
  • We are proud of our low production costs, but in order to continue to get the word out, your contributions can help this idea travel the country. 

The Impact

Regional Rhythms is a music project aiming to engage not only our hometown local musicians, but musicians from local communities all around the Midwest (and more!). The Midwest is covered in "small" big cities who's music scenes tend to get overlooked in the shadow of larger known cities. Regional Rhythms crew know how special and lively these smaller music scenes are and we want the world to know as well.

Through the submission of a short, original sample of music inspired by any of our pre-recorded play-along music, musicians can contribute and add their own unique layers and watch songs come to life. Musicians then not only get to be apart of a collaborative project with musicians from many different states, they also have the ability to share the impact that their unique local music has on their life and creativity.

Challenges

As a project based on our community and contributors, we risk not raising enough recognition or acknowledgment. But as we continue to connect with music lovers all around the United States, we can continue to push to get the word out. Your contribution and backing do just that and we thank you! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Again, this project is designed to thrive around a large community following. Regional Rhythms has a presence on multiple social media platforms available for you to follow, share, and contribute.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Eldor and companions are developing a fantasy/reality musical feature movie focusing on the power of positive existence. Negative and positive being the same albeit from different perspective.. ..darkness and light, sadness and laughter.... all opposites being the same.

Eldor has been entertaining and creating his own artistry from the age of 9. He has performed on stage and created various video productions which are referred and linked to in the attached presentations

Eldor's vision is to bring a creative perspective of living to the public through his music and film..

The contributions through the crowd-funding will allow this program to be expedited  in a short time. It will launch and introduce the guidance of Eldor in the power of positivism and blissful existence.

In order for this to happen the first of five music albums will be created.

 

Requirements & What You Receive 

The goal is to raise sufficient funds to launch the first of the five albums in a well known studio with the assistance of the legendary Tony Drake in Cape Town.

From this album the first videos will be produced and published. The total five albums will be produce in the same way and eventually all the music videos will fall into the story line of a full feature movie

This initial funding requires $7500  for 

  1. Studio recording
  2. Photo-shoots
  3. Preparation of marketing material for the album
  4. Preparation of distribution networks
  5. Advertisement campaigns
  6. Contracting of various support services
  7. The launch of the first Album of Eldor for the feature film

(There are plans to start with the video production for this album whilst the album is being recorded.)

The first 50 contributors that pledge $100 each will receive a signed copy of the full album as well as a complimentary music video compilation of the first album when complete.

The first 20 contributors that pledge $50 dollars will receive a copy of the first album once complete.

All other contributors will receive a copy of Eldor's latest song "Let me out"in MP3 format

 

Impact of your contribution:

Eldor has a unique perspective on the power of positivity and how to bring this to the public. through his music. video's and and feature film. Your contributions will enable Eldor to bring his beautiful artistry and message to the world and many people will benefit from this  inspiration and guidance.

 

Risks & Challenges

Clearly as with most ventures there are risks.

Eldor has teamed up with an experienced businessman, Peter Winter who is supporting him on this venture. 

All business aspects are managed by Peter who has experience ranging from being on the Board of Directors of international large corporations to small business management. Currently running his own company in Cape Town, Peter has provided Eldor the facilities to launch his vision.

 

Further assistance

In order for this project to be successful we are also hoping for support from anyone that is willing to assist in sharing the request for funding and making use of the Indiegogo tools.

Whilst we have commitments from over 100 radio stations worldwide to review and possibly air Eldor's material, We would appreciate anyone that can support us by advertising and this campaign to anyone they feel can assist... including large production houses and recording studios. 

Eldor -The Undefined Creator - has a unique vision to assist all with the power of positive energy through his unique artistry

Thank you for considering and for contributing... may the power of positivity remain with you....we know it will!

story: James "Poo Jr" Simons grew up in the tough neighborhood of 40 Projects in SouthSide Jamaica Queens. I used music as a outlet to vent emotions but I started to take it seriously after my Nana passed away, so 9/11 2001 is a double tragedy for me. I made my first song with a laptop, cheap mic, blown out speakers, but ever since then I been on the ground running and improving. I founded my label Infamous Heat Entertainment at 14 years old but made it a LLC at 20 years old. Then I went on to drop my debut album September 28, 2020 which is my birthday, "God's Gift to Earth" independent. This started to create a buzz I have not seen, leading to hitting 100k streams across all platforms. After that I would then go on to get my first celebrity collaboration with Crank Lucas on the song "Twerk" which is my second highest streamed song. For now I am working on my second album and I wish to take this dream into reality by increasing my production value and get some features with my idols this year such as Fat Joe, Bow Wow, Kcamp, Desiigner, just to name a few. To complete all these goals to pull this dream into reality, I would need around 200k but any little thing from a dollar to a dime would help...thank you for reading sincerely James "Poo Jr" Simons.
story_txt: James "Poo Jr" Simons grew up in the tough neighborhood of 40 Projects in SouthSide Jamaica Queens. I used music as a outlet to vent emotions but I started to take it seriously after my Nana passed away, so 9/11 2001 is a double tragedy for me. I made my first song with a laptop, cheap mic, blown out speakers, but ever since then I been on the ground running and improving. I founded my label Infamous Heat Entertainment at 14 years old but made it a LLC at 20 years old. Then I went on to drop my debut album September 28, 2020 which is my birthday, "God's Gift to Earth" independent. This started to create a buzz I have not seen, leading to hitting 100k streams across all platforms. After that I would then go on to get my first celebrity collaboration with Crank Lucas on the song "Twerk" which is my second highest streamed song. For now I am working on my second album and I wish to take this dream into reality by increasing my production value and get some features with my idols this year such as Fat Joe, Bow Wow, Kcamp, Desiigner, just to name a few. To complete all these goals to pull this dream into reality, I would need around 200k but any little thing from a dollar to a dime would help...thank you for reading sincerely James "Poo Jr" Simons.

story:
Proyecto "Semilla de paz" / Project "Seeds of Peace"

We are a family of cultural entrepeneurs. We believe in a self sufficient life in harmony with nature. We have been living en a rural community since about four years ago. We can be found in the village of Mirabel in the township of La Azulita in the northern part of the state of Merida in Venezuela located about 1500 meters above sea level.

We are the guardians of a living culture that is rescuing the values of conscientiousness that allows us to connect ourselves to the honored natural world while respecting this great home we call Earth.

 

Nuestro trabajo / our work

We look to spread like seeds a message of consciousness, causing a minimum impact in the space that we live. We have responded to the call of great wisdom that consists of planting and cultivating with our own hands the food that we eat. This is our inspiration to compose songs to offer to the collective conscious.

We are plastic artists propagators of peace through our music. We give workshops. We paint murals. Our message is of the emancipation of man and woman to live in unity with the earth. The musical genre that characterizes us is hip hop with distinctive rhythms

Adding to this, our focus of production includes: bio construction, the planting of various vegetables, artisan textiles (all cotton cloth diapers and menstrual pads that are washable and reusable) a screen printing workshop, and a simple home based recording and audiovisual studio. We find ourselves at a middle point between the simple life of the country and the use of technology. Because of this, electricity is indispensable for the realization of our activities.

 

Objetivos y vision / Objetives and visions

Our objective is to improve our electrical system and recording studio to continue realizing our life's work, improving production with greater efficiency.

And our vision is to record next albums with a better sound and collaborate with the recording service to artists from nearby communities to promote projects from baharekestudio

 

Apoyo mutuo / Mutual support / Requirements

350mts of concentric cable: $ 800 (for electricity)

Microphone: $55

Mixing console: $400

Audio monitors: $300

Hard disc: $190

Graphic Drawing Tablet: $250

Midi keyboard: $250

Camera, photo and video: $800

Tripod: $60     

 

Logistics and support for the mounting of electricity $300                                                                                                               

Total: $4045

We have the talent, we have the ability and the energy, but we do not have the equipment. We believe that we have all the necessary resources to manifest a positive vision in our community. Due to the situation of economic, social and cultural instability that our country is going through, we turn to you to solicit support to strengthen our project, to continue growing and to expand our work. We believe in abundance and mutual support!

This project goes beyond fundraising, it is our life's project.

Thank you for your support. Blessings...

The support of all of you is very important to achieve this project because we would cause greater impact in the community where we live. That support should not necessarily be money, you can also publish it and spread it to make it known to other friends who can contribute economically. We are very excited for this opportunity to get to know this platform and this community of people who are supported. thank you very much...

We are aware that if we do not achieve the full economic fund, we will not be able to have the equipment. But we do not lose faith and we believe that if everything is not achieved, our priority will be the electric system and continue with the workshops in the schools.

 

Thank you for your support. Blessings

story:
All my life I’ve loved superheroes.
The first one I really remember loving was Superman, because he had the power to do almost anything he wanted, but he still chose to do good with them. As soon as I was 18 I got that “S'' symbol tattooed right on my chest over my heart. No regrets.

Eventually, I discovered my “super power” of music, and I had to figure out how to use that power for good. Pretty much everybody told me how ridiculous that was.
So I stopped talking about it, and until more recently, I wasn’t able to show that side of me again.

I have more context now. I know what I want to do. And, I know how I want to do it.
More importantly, after years of shedding the multiple layers of shame, I had associated with that dream. I’m finally brave enough to do it with all my heart. I’m finally ready to use my powers for good.

This album is a journey through growth, learning, and hope, despite your various fears and failures.

I’ve actually written, accidentally lost, and re-written many versions of this introduction. Some, I was pretty happy with, others I was not. You could say this section alone has been a journey to grow and learn from, complete with the fears and failures.

Through all this, I’ve come to the conclusion that your best is always changing from moment to moment.

At this moment, this is my best, and I hope you’ll join me on the rest of this journey.

What I’m Asking

There is a lot of mystery surrounding what goes into making an album if you’re not in the industry, so without boring you TOO much I wanted to break it down for you as clearly as possible…

  • For the recording, mixing, and engineering I reached out to the amazing Sean Mclaughlin at 37ft Productions. He quoted me $12,000. That included all of his time, the use of the space, and the basic musician’s fees for tracking (drums and bass).
     
  • There were a couple of other brilliant musicians and all-around humans I wanted on this album and I’m jazzed to say they all were available! The cost of their time to be on this project is $1,000
     
  • And finally, I reached out to the immensely talented Jay Frigoletto to master this project. Mastering is basically the process that makes the recorded music balanced and ready for all the different listening mediums. I.e. CD’s, streaming, vinyl, etc…He generously agreed to do all that for $2,000
     
  • All of this will get me a full-album of 12 songs that mean the world to me, and I think you will really connect with it. 

Any additional costs for marketing, distribution, or really whatever else is needed through the course of a project like this, I will be responsible for.
With what I’m asking of you, it is the least that I can do.

I really believe in this project, and I will make sure it gets made no matter what.
So if I fall short of the goal, here, I am absolutely going to do whatever it takes to make it happen.
Seriously.
Like… I don’t currently know how to sell my kidney or what channels I need to contact to do so, but I’m pretty resourceful!


What I’m Offering

I spent a lot of time trying to come up with a lot of unique perks for your generous contributions.
Since this album is about growth, I tried to include that in a few of them as well!

They range from a thank you note you can actually plant that will turn into flowers.
So you can really watch the “seeds of gratitude” “Grow” ?

To a session where we write a song together.
*song-writing experience not required 

And even a SMALL tattoo of YOUR choosing on my actual body
*some restrictions obviously apply

And honestly, if you don’t see something on there that resonates with you, I still want to make sure you feel reciprocity for your contribution.
So reach out to me directly, and we can figure something out!
 

What This Means To Me

I’ve touched on it a bit already, but this album means a lot to me.

For me, this album is about more than just music and lyrics.
It’s really about the message.

The music is the medium for what I’m trying to do, which is provide a soundtrack to a new narrative.

To make things like growth and vulnerability more popular.
And to inspire people to find more love and honesty in themselves and others.

I know this may sound like an ambitious thing to do with an album, but hey, you can’t blame a guy for trying, right?
 

Keeping It Real...

I’m beyond stoked to launch this campaign and make an album, but...
I’m still scared.

I’m scared I won’t meet the mark.
I’m scared people won’t like the music.
I’m scared people won’t connect with the message as much as I do.
I’m scared I’m not good enough.
 

I’m human, and as one I will always have these fears.
But also as a human, I have a choice.
And I choose, despite all of these fears, to move forwards anyways.
I choose to show up and put my best in, day in and day out.
That’s what I’ve always done, and that’s what I promise you, I will continue to do.


If You Can’t Comfortably Contribute

Don’t. I mean it.
If this is something you really connect with, but aren’t in a place financially to make a contribution, I don’t want you to.

There are so many ways you can show your support if this is something that resonates with you. What would really help is sending this to someone you think might connect with it.

This album is about connecting people with other people who share the values I’ve talked about here. A siren's song for the people who think they can make this world a better place.

If you have any questions at all, or want to find out how you can help more, please don’t hesitate to reach out. You are important. This is important.

And together, I really think we can make some Music You Grow To.

story:
About Me

I’m Stevie. I’m a music producer from St. Louis based in Japan.

 

My Story

While it would be nice to say that music has been my sole passion ever since I was in diapers; that I was an active brass band member all throughout grade school, unfortunately, that’s not the case. It wasn’t until after I was introduced to a music software program as a teenager, that music production became something more than just an abstract concept.

I remember spending countless hours experimenting with new sounds and tinkering with interfaces during those years. However, as time went on, like so many other independent artists, despite whatever progress I made I formed the habit of being my own worst critic. I unwittingly allowed mountains of self-doubt to prevent me from pursuing music in any professional capacity. Fortunately, the opportunity to travel abroad and meet people from various cultures, who have shown genuine interest in my work, has been a reassuring and encouraging experience.

 

(RTZL EP artwork by Sevi Iko Dhomochevsky / mixed & mastered by Dietfried)

 

Yet even during those periods of my life when I lacked any confidence in my music, my passion for music never permitted me to stay away from it. After working on a few small scale projects that never saw the light of day, during the summer of 2015, I worked up enough hutzpah (and personal savings) to release a small EP “RTZL”. Although RTZL was far from being a success financially, it was a deeply personal one nonetheless. Reading the lone comment left by a total stranger who had actually paid for and enjoyed my work, was validating. It taught me the importance of being confident, patient and ambitious.

This time around, I've set a more grandiose goal. Via the inclusion of features intended to enhance the listening experience (e.g. artwork, merchandise, music videos etc.), I want to deliver my very best without having to compromise quality. If my story resonates with you then please choose a perk that best suits your budget. Thank you for all of your support and I look forward to sharing ITTO with you in the near future.

Mad Love & Respect,

Stevie

 

What Is ITTO?

Touching upon multiple genres, ITTO is a collection of 8 narrative-driven compositions inspired by some of my favorite storylines, themes and personal observations.

(ITTO artwork by Kasi Minami)

  1. Ogami Itto
  2. Digable
  3. Welfare Queen
  4. Now U Behave?
  5. Chotto-Matte
  6. 5th Element
  7. Bivouac
  8. Sayonara

 

Why Only Instrumentals?

Since my early teens, The Silver Surfer has been my favorite comic book character. Within its lore, entities known as Watchers observe and document all events in the multiverse. They vow to only observe and never interfere with any event or civilization they monitor. Consequently, these principles have worked their way into my creative process. I regard the instrumental as my observation and the absence of vocals as my refrain from interfering.

 

How Much Will It Cost?

In order to release the LP at its fullest potential, I need your help. Below is a summary of the costs. All contributions will go directly towards paying for the expenses below.

  • Mixing & Mastering services: $1,200
  • CD Duplication: $600
  • 12” Vinyl Pressing (25 units): $1,300
  • Merch: $800
  • Legal Fees: $500

ITTO Album Total Cost: $4,400

STRETCH GOAL #1: $6,000

If we reach $6,000, I will be able to film a music video!

STRETCH GOAL #2: $8,000

If we reach $8,000, I will be able to film an additional music video and pay for promotion and marketing!

*Pledgers will receive updates regarding album status and pending deliveries *

 

When Will The LP Be Released?

My goal is to release the lead single and music video late December 2017, with the full LP released mid-January 2018.

 

Other Ways to Support

If you’re not able to make a monetary pledge at the moment, I more than understand. Sharing the campaign on social media would be just as invaluable. Spreading the word about ITTO greatly helps increase its chances of success!

story:
Hey! I'm Kieran Conor, and I'm a dude just like you. I rap, or more descriptively, I talk about things rhythmically over hip-hop beats. I have a boatload of songs that I'd like to properly record and release, and I need your help making it happen!

Here's My Somewhat Official Blurb:

Kieran Conor speaks rhythmically over hip-hop beats and doesn't really like talking about himself in the third-person. Instead of rapping simply about "sex, drugs, and money," he talks about his lack thereof, and tells stories about everyday experiences intertwined with clever wordplay and tongue-in-cheek lyrics.

People have described Kieran Conor as "a nice guy rapper" and have said his music is like "a guided mediation" or "how Jesus would've rapped" (only because of the storytelling; water remains water when Kieran speaks). He'll put words in your ears that are guaranteed to put a smile on your face.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I'm asking for $500 because that's the IndieGogo minimum. Any bit at all will help, and I'll be able to make it work with only a little.
  • Costs include recording sessions and/or recording equipment, mixing & mastering, getting CDs (maybe vinyl) produced, and promotional materials
  • I am frugal as hell, so believe me when I say that any donation will go a long way.
  • You can get just about anything you want! CDs, maybe vinyl, a song written about you, even lunch! (I thought about getting stickers or posters made, but I'd rather put the money towards the music itself, y'know?)
  • All funds will support the production of my music. If the whole goal isn't reached, I'll do what I can and maybe start with an EP instead of a full album.

The Impact

You will be a part of the absolute most exciting and historic musical event that has ever occurred for me personally. You can help a damn good album come to life. You can be a part of this aural adventure!

Risks & Challenges

There is little to no risk. I've had these songs ready to go for so long there's no way this album doesn't get made. The main challenges will be scheduling the recording sessions and then getting it mastered, but I know a few folks who can help guide me along that process.

Other Ways You Can Help

No cash? No problem! If you can share this campaign with a friend who might be interested, that would be phenomenal. Thanks!

I am frugal as hell, so believe me when I say that any donation will go a long way.

You can get just about anything you want! CDs, maybe vinyl, a song written about you, even lunch! (I thought about getting stickers or posters made, but I'd rather put the money towards the music itself, y'know?)

All funds will support the production of my music. If the whole goal isn't reached, I'll do what I can and maybe start with an EP instead of a full album.    The Impact You will be a part of the absolute most exciting and historic musical event that has ever occurred for me personally. You can help a damn good album come to life. You can be a part of this aural adventure!
  Risks & Challenges There is little to no risk. I've had these songs ready to go for so long there's no way this album doesn't get made. The main challenges will be scheduling the recording sessions and then getting it mastered, but I know a few folks who can help guide me along that process.
  Other Ways You Can Help No cash? No problem! If you can share this campaign with a friend who might be interested, that would be phenomenal. Thanks!

story: Hello, we are Kevin, Nate, Greg, and Dave, otherwise known as Steeze Knees! We are a rock n roll band from Cleveland, Ohio with a big goal. Along with our manager, Riley, we are planning a cross-country DIY tour to bring the steezy love across this great country we call home. We have shows booked from Detroit to South Dakota to Los Angeles and beyond. The only problem is that we need a van that can fit all of us (4 band members, 1 manager, 1 driver, and 1 roadie/sound girl) and all of our equipment. Vans are expensive and so is tour, which is why we are asking for your hard earned dollars. We are all working multiple jobs, selling all our stuff, and deeply considering selling our plasma to finance this experience. As hard as we work, we are still young students who are limited to low-wage jobs and school schedules which makes it challenging to make all the money we need to make this work. Our tour starts on June 15th, and we need to secure a van at least a month in advance just to be #safe. We are asking for $4750 because we found a perfect van that would fit all of us and our stuff for $4500 (!!!!) and Indiegogo takes 5% of what is donated to you as their fee, which explains the $250 wiggle area. I speak for all of us when we say that we cannot express how thankful we would be to all of you for helping us achieve this goal. We know it is a lot to ask for and we know that so many people struggle for money, so any donations would be appreciated times 10000000 million. We will play your garage, serenade you to sleep, bake you a cake, play your grandma's birthday party, anything to show that we are grateful for your contribution. It is all of our lifelong dream to be able to tour the country and share the music we create with other people. The world is so stressful and sad right now and what they really need is some good ol' fashioned rock n roll to remind them that we are all alive and here for a reason (TO ROCK). Anything helps, whether it's $0.75 or $700, and we will love all of your donations equally! Thank you so much for helping us out! And if you can't donate, please listen/ share our music with your friends or share this so we can achieve both our dreams of getting to tour in a smelly van with our best friends and also sharing the music we put our heart and soul into with the people that inspire us to write it.

story:
Hi, my name is Zach Webster, founder of  Rad Rocket.  We are a small business based out of Pawhuska, Oklahoma serving the surrounding area.  I am trying to grow the customer base and increase business, making one hand built custom Guitar/Bass cabinet at a time.  I have always valued originality more than anything.   I love music, art, carpentry and creating.  So, I put those things together to start Rad Rocket Cabs.  Ive built 12 prototypes under the guidance of my grandfather, August Hague. He has been a carpenter and craftsman for 60 years and has taught me the strongest building techniques.
                 With our standard model, we start by giving you complete freedom of choice in all aspects with a few special design features added for good measure.  These unique choices give you a boutique quality product at an affordable price. 
        We start with a selection of premium tone woods which include Baltic Birch, Maple, Cedar, Ash, and Pine.  We even let you choose the type of wood used in the bracing and baffle giving you the ultimate control over your cabs sonic character.
         I can leave your custom cab naked with a clear coat, coat it with a particular stain or totally cover it in any color vinyl you can imagine. You have 100's of vinyl color options to choose from followed with 1000's of grill cover options, even your OWN images can be printed on the woven grill cloth.  We offer 12 colors of piping which include red, blue, green, brown, tan, cream, light grey, dark grey, gold, white, silver and classic black. Two choices of hardware (nickel plated or Black metal), two handle styles (leather or rubber)  and  three back options:  open, closed, and convertible back designs (patent pending).
         One essential factor that is often overlooked is whether the back of the cabinet containing the speaker or speakers you use is open or closed.  There’s a big difference between the two since cabinet construction defines the shape of the sound wave that reaches the ears of those listening.  A myriad of other elements of cabinet construction are also relevant, including the type of wood used, the size and depth of the cabinet, and the thickness of the baffle, which is the piece of wood the speaker is mounted to. But whether the back of that cabinet is open or closed is the most dramatic and visibly obvious variation. Most open backed cabinets are actually just partly open, with upper and lower panels going halfway up. Open back cabs allow some of the speaker sound to emerge from the back and to a lesser extent, the sides. On stage, this abundance of sound can be quite helpful when monitors are inadequate or absent. This also allows some excellent sonic opportunities in the studio, too. Microphones can be placed at the back of the cabinet, where slightly dirtier and darker tones are typically available, and in an isolation booth the sound tends to mix and fill the space better. Without a closed back to naturally compress a speaker’s voice, open back cabinets might be considered more organic or accurate representatives of the sound that a guitar produces. High frequencies in particular benefit from this, but open-backed cabs tend to be gentle to the entire spectrum. Not so with closed back cabinets, which tend to accentuate the mid range and bass sounds. They are directional and punchier which create no back spill or side leakage.  Amplifiers with the same circuitry sound radically different when they are running open and closed-back cabinets. With the convertible back you get both options at the drop of a hat. Held on with an active 28 pounds of force using my patent pending design . All cabinets are also numbered, labeled, and signed on the inside.
          We offer an awesome product at a fair price! Sure you can get generic overpriced cabs made from inferior materials but why when you can get a genuine piece of personalized art from Rad Rocket for about the same price?  We are primarily a custom shop but I can't let you guys have all the fun, so I created  11 "special edition" cab designs that are typically more expensive depending on the edition than our standard custom cab because they use very exotic tone woods, unique cover upgrades, added features, or a combination.
      91 percent  of our donations go directly into labor and cost of materials for your custom cab, 9 percent  goes to indiegogo.  Check out my video and image gallery and please share this with any musicians you know.  Don't forget to use the indiegogo share tools. All ordering details below!

My email is RadRocketcabs@gmail.com
My phone number is 904 294 1367 call or text
You can reach me via my personal or business facebook as well. https://www.facebook.com/zach.webster.184 or https://www.facebook.com/radrocketcabs#

story:
Who Are FURIAN? 

Formed in 2014, FURIAN are a hard rock/melodic post-hardcore band and a musical force to be reckoned with. They are gaining as much attention for their infectious attitude and kindness as they are for their heartfelt and energetic sound. After securing a slot on Kerrang radio after just 2 years of existence they are looking to continue their journey and bring a bright spark of hope to rock lovers worldwide. With two UK tours under their belts and a host of music video singles, FURIAN are seizing new listeners every day. Don't take our word for it. Ask Alex Baker (Kerrang) who was lost for words and simply said "THIS-BAND-RULE".

What do FURIAN stand for? 

Let's get to the point with this. Are you sick of hearing overly produced rock bands with nothing new to offer and the same old plastic sound and cliche lyrics? Are you tired of scouring Spotify and not stumbling across anything fresh and exciting? Well this is where you can help solve that problem. 

FURIAN are a totally DIY rock band from the UK who pride themselves on making REAL music for REAL people. The only down side? Like every serious musician out there, we have sacrificed careers and the stability to go with it in the hope that we will gain enough support to make music full time. There is no backup plan. We don't have money and we don't have sponsorship. All we have is ourselves and our fans. Many would strike us off as a pip-dream but we refuse to give up. We don't want to play to corporate rules or make recycled garbage for the sake of earning money. We want to make music that can truly connect with people and change their lives for the better. We want to make music that can last forever. And what's more? FURIAN always do things with good humour and a smile.

FURIAN may have formed in late 2014 but we have struggled as musicians individually for over 15 years, hoping that some day we'd get the chance to share our music on a global level. And who has the power to make that happen? The answer is simple. You! 

What's In It For YOU? 

We have worked really hard to put together some great packages for our supporters. There's all sorts on offer if you choose to support us. We have CD's, t-shirts, hand-written goodies and more. But more than anything you'll not only be making our very first album happen but you'll be helping to create history, to change our lives and give us hope that some day we can show the world what us and all of our friends are truly made of. Everyone needs something to believe in. We believe that all of us can make a difference.

Take every rock band stereotype you know and throw it out of the window. This isn't about ego, this isn't about fame, this is about the love of music and the strength of good people in numbers. This isn't even about us. It's about starting a family that can grow and progress into something truly special. We know we're nothing without support and we know that our efforts alone will never be enough. Get behind this project and you'll always have a place in the creation of this album and in the heart of this band. 

The Album

APPROACH:DESCEND - For us, this is something that needs to happen. We've come this far and want to go further. There's been a resounding belief in FURIAN and the feedback has been enough for us to take on board and give it our best shot. We feel that best shot should come in album format. We are humbled by the support and positivity and are ready for the next level.

The album will be a 12 track and is based on a concept which we will later reveal. So far we have only done an EP and select singles with videos. A 12 track album is a big deal. It's a huge commitment and a lot of work for a lot of people. Unfortunately that does mean it's going to be costly. That's a reality we can't avoid. However...

We aren't going to be pulling any punches with this one. We intend to demo a lot of music and pick our best efforts and then transform them into a piece of audio magic. There'll be catchy choruses, heavy riffs, dreamy sections, guitar solos, breakdowns, chilled out songs, happy songs, you name it. It's all going to be in there. If we're going to showcase what we're about and what you guys mean to us then we to be as non-contrived as possible. There is a concept but there are no rules. Whatever sounds the best to us will feature in this album and we aren't going to be aiming it at any target market audience or any of that nonsense. We know it's  brave but we think it's the right choice to make. We are about music and not money and that's why the initial outlay has to come from ourselves and from you guys. The intended result? Let's just say that this album will be a giant monument to real passion and we're hoping it can leave a real mark in its own way. Exciting right?! 

The Budget

We know that the budget seems crazy but it's going to take a lot to get this off the ground. Being in a band is expensive, more so than many might think but we want to be as transparent as possible with this and that's why we're going to post our budget breakdown right here for you. Remember, if we're going to reward you guys for your support then we have to budget for that too. Ok here goes.

5000 Eur - studio time and other production costing.

3000 Eur - t-shirts and merch.

4000 Eur - 4 music videos.

1000 Eur - concepting and artwork.

2000 Eur - CD physicals.

1000 Eur - photography and promotional materials.

4000 Eur - press and advertising budget.  

Sorry for the pricing being in Euros. It's just how IndieGogo do things which is ok with us!

If we hit our goal we get funded. If we don't then we don't get a penny. It's as simple as that. Any questions? Feel free to message us. We'd love to hear from you.

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING US

story:
LAVA INVOCATOR

Music is the great power of mankind and the source of human emotions. Black metal is the mix of power, aggression, melodism and brutalism. Lava Invocator is the mirror of human being and emotion, this is lava that flows to every corner of metalheart. We play our music by the heart and every time would like to improve ourselves.

What We Need & What You Get

Now, we're finishing mixing and mastering, so, very soon it will be done. Most likely, we'll finish all the job within two months. Every dollar will help us to create something good and new. And of course we will be grateful to everybody who will support us and we will send gifts to every one! Let it be some kind of New Year gifts ;-)

Collected amount will go for:

$550 for final studio and musician time

$100 for final artwork

$150 for mastering

$650 for CD duplication

OUR GIFTS TO YOU:

- We send our digital release * for free - to every one who send any donation (even 1 dollar)

- We send CD * with our debut album and signature - to everyone who support us 25 $ or more

- We send digital release * and T-short ** - to everyone who support us 35 $ or more

- We send CD * with signature and T-short ** - to everyone who support us 45 $ or more

So, every contributor will obtain a New Year gift from Lava Invocator :-)

--

* Release will be finished after the end of this campaign plus two months.

** Please contact us with e-mail: kudinetoprosto@ya.ru to specify required t-short size (S, M, L, XL)

*** We. probably, cannot cover shipping costs

--

Low Risks

As we mentioned early we are on the finish line and soon will have completed album. All mixing and mastering will be done within two months, after that we will have opportunity to produce CD`s. As musicians who do their job truly, we have 99.9% no doubts that all job will done. That is the point! Moreover, your support will give us possibility to do it much better! To develop ourselves, contribute into developpment of metal music, to have an impact to music. That's GREAT!

Other Ways You Can Help (In the case when you can't contribute):

Help us spread the word about this campaign by sharing the link, telling your friends, and write your feedback (about our music) . All your questions and propositions please send here https://www.facebook.com/lavainvocator 

Listen to our music, listen to good metal music, stay metal and good luck!
story_txt: LAVA INVOCATORMusic is the great power of mankind and the source of human emotions. Black metal is the mix of power, aggression, melodism and brutalism. Lava Invocator is the mirror of human being and emotion, this is lava that flows to every corner of metalheart. We play our music by the heart and every time would like to improve ourselves.What We Need & What You GetNow, we're finishing mixing and mastering, so, very soon it will be done. Most likely, we'll finish all the job within two months. Every dollar will help us to create something good and new. And of course we will be grateful to everybody who will support us and we will send gifts to every one! Let it be some kind of New Year gifts ;-)Collected amount will go for:$550 for final studio and musician time$100 for final artwork$150 for mastering$650 for CD duplicationOUR GIFTS TO YOU:- We send our digital release * for free - to every one who send any donation (even 1 dollar)- We send CD * with our debut album and signature - to everyone who support us 25 $ or more- We send digital release * and T-short ** - to everyone who support us 35 $ or more- We send CD * with signature and T-short ** - to everyone who support us 45 $ or moreSo, every contributor will obtain a New Year gift from Lava Invocator :-)--* Release will be finished after the end of this campaign plus two months.** Please contact us with e-mail: kudinetoprosto@ya.ru to specify required t-short size (S, M, L, XL)*** We. probably, cannot cover shipping costs--Low RisksAs we mentioned early we are on the finish line and soon will have completed album. story:
Foto: ©Ana Ferreira

 

das viagens e dos encontros

of travelling and meetings

(PT)
As viagens cobrem todo o tipo de distâncias e percursos, mas a que escolhemos com este projecto, com estas canções partindo destes autores será seguramente infinita, nem que seja no nosso coração. Ainda assim precisamos de etapas, e gravar o percurso feito até aqui será sem dúvida uma delas.
el Sur começou o seu caminho como um projecto a voz e guitarra que depressa percebeu que a viagem que iniciava pedia uma tripulação maior, do tamanho de uma mão inteira.
Virámo-nos para a América Latina e encontrámos na aventurança dos seus povos e na poesia de algumas das suas almas maiores como Victor Jara ou Violeta Parra, Viglietti ou Guillen, um incrível mapa ilustrado para a esperança.
Descobrimos que para interpretar este mapa pintado a tintas feitas de cheiro a terra, floresta e chuva, nos teriamos de virar ao contrário, talvez de cabeça para baixo ou do avesso. Depois de várias escalas portuárias em que fomos abraçados por tantos corações que nos foram ajudando a decifrar estes mares do Sul decidimos parar um pouco mais no porto de Violeta Parra. Desembarcámos terra a dentro e fomos abraçados em cada rua, em cada aldeia, pelo povo chileno e guiados pelos índios Mapuche.


Foto: ©João Serra de Almeida / XZibit Art

Imensa a marca que nos ficou no peito. Voltámos ao mar, descemos o Atlántico, como só este mapa e mais nenhum outro nos ensinará alguma vez, voltámos a casa, a casa que nos esmaga, o Norte!
Decidimos que era o tempo de mostrar o nosso diário desta viagem imaginária, revelar algumas partes do mapa, aquelas que julgamos entender pelo menos e cozinhar um CevicheDê. Precisamos da vossa ajuda porque este caminho precisa de toda a vossa ternura e solidariedade. Porque é, e será sempre, feito convosco.
(EN)
The trips cover all kinds of distances and routes, but the one we chose with this project, with these songs starting from these authors will surely be infinite, even if that's only in our heart. Still, we need steps, and put on record the course we've done so far will undoubtedly be one of them.
el Sur began its journey as a project made of voice and guitar but quickly realized that the trip that was initiated called for a larger crew,one the size of an entire hand.
We turned ourselves to Latin America and found in the advent of their peoples and in the poetry of some of their larger souls like Victor Jara or Violeta Parra, Viglietti or Guillen, an incredible illustrated map for hope. We found that in order to interpret this map painted in smells of earth, forest and rain, we would have to turn upside down, perhaps upside down or inside out. After several port stops in which we were embraced by so many fine hearts that helped us to decipher these southern seas we decided to stop a bit more in the port of Violeta Parra. We went inland and were hugged in every street, in every village, by the Chilean people and guided by the Mapuche Indians.
Immense the mark that remains now on our chest. We went back to the sea going down the Atlantic, as only this map and no other one will ever teach us, we returned home, the house that crushes us, the North!
We decided that it was time to show you the travel diary of this imaginary voyage, reveal some parts of the Map, the one we believe that we understand and cook a CevicheDê. We need your help because this path needs all your tenderness and solidarity. Because it is, and will always be, done with all of you.

We need your help because this path needs all your tenderness and solidarity. Because it is, and will always be, done with all of you.

story:
ALL YOU KNOW IS HELL


ALL YOU KNOW IS HELL is a solo project by Joseph Merlini: post-metal/post-rock percussionist and vocalist in Brooklyn, New York. Originally hailed from Orlando, Florida in search of an escape of a mundane and intimately proverse existence, Joseph took a different approach to his life in pursuit of emotional freedom and expression through music and other arts. Although Joseph has spent the better part of the last 16 years creating various musical projects and drumming for different hardcore bands (most recently WRIST DEEP of Brooklyn, NY), his efforts and passions are now primarily focused on his solo project and upcoming sophomore LP. For ALL YOU KNOW IS HELL, the concept and album touch upon personal struggles and experiences with sex, depression, anxiety, addiction, love and heartbreak. The album is an experimental outlet of provoked emotional trauma and intellect, providing an experimental landscape for exploring the deepest and most sincere struggles of private life.

Listen on BANDCAMP: AllYouKnowIsHell 

 

SUPPORT

ALL YOU KNOW IS HELL is an emotional outlet for the most sensitive of intimate exploits, a melody of deep sensitivity for the slightly deranged and curious. By supporting this campaign and the authenticity behind the message, you are helping to spread the music to the audience it was written and recorded for. 

 

THE BREAKDOWN 

$1,500 GOAL

All funds raised for this EP contribute to:

  • Recording
  • Studio Rental
  • Sound Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Packaging
  • Album Art + Merch

 

SPREAD THE WORD

Use the Indiegogo share tools and help spread the word to support this project. 

FOLLOW on INSTAGRAM: @ALLYOUKNOWISHELL

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm a professional musician from Riga, Latvia
  • In history of Latvia there is no one who had ever made a 3D hologram cover photo and in the whole world it happens rarely
  • After this project, Latvian art scene will change forever

What We Need & What You Get

  • 300$ for a professional photo session ( for embossed hologram)
  • 3500$ for a master hologram and production
  • 4200$ CD and LP (vinyl expenses)
  • You get fresh and original music and design

The Impact

  • In Latvian history such an event has never happened
  • New perspective of how design should look for albums in general

Risks & Challenges

  • I spent one year of my life just to find the right holographic company for the work (analog or digital)
  • The whole project including the process of writing songs has taken me four to five years, so there's no way back

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like & Share will be appreciated
  • Use Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
HUMBLY REQUESTING A HAND UP, NOT A HAND OUT


WHO AM I:  My name is Brian Hardison, aka ThirdEye.  I'm a ghost writer, hip hop artist, children's author, single father to my teenage son, Jayvonty and a lifelong resident of Brooklyn, NY.   Over the years I’ve been faced with several challenges, the biggest being the complete loss of my eyesight.   I’ve faced many obstacles because of my condition, but through determination and perseverance I’m very excited to share the results of my hard work:  The 3rdI Project.  The project features two of my passions, hip hop music and children’s books.   So far, I've made a debut album, Never Standing Still, as well as three children's books:  The Dreamblocker, A Sheep In Wolf's Clothing, and The Invisible Tiger.   

Moving forward,  I've decided to put my foucs on the music portion of my project.

WHY BE AN INDEPENDENT ARTIST:  Of course, I'd be flattered if a record company showed interest in me.   Being on my own, not being able to see and trying to find success in the music industry has been a challenge and it would be so much easier to let someone else be in charge.  But, challenge or not - It’s important for me not to have my creativity or finances controlled by a record label.  I want to have the decision making power of what kind of music I create & record, my brand and how it's developed, where & how often I perform, and what my marketing looks like.  Nothing worth having is ever easy, right?!    

PURPOSE OF THIS CROWDFUNDING PAGE:   As an Independent artist with no financial backing, I’ve faced the challenging task of financing everything on my own.  I've set up this Crowdfunding Page in the hope of receiving financial support to create more music and having it, along with my debut album, successfully promoted through social media and radio airplay.    

My Debut album, Never Standing Still, is now current available on iTunes and Apple Music.  Please click on the link below to hear a preview of the tracks:

     Listen NOW :)

https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/never-standin...

 

                    BREAKDOWN OF EXPENSES FOR CROWDFUNDING PROJECTS:

Ownership of 5 Beats from my Debut Album:  $1,000 Per Beat:  $5,000      

Music Videos for My Debut Album:  $3000 Per Video (5 videos):  $15,000

Creating Exclusive Beats: $500.00 per track  (13 songs):    $6,500

Studio Time:  $50.00  per hour  (50 hours):     $2,500

Mastering:  $150.00 per track  (13 tracks):     $1,950  

                                              Total Music Expense:  $30,950

 

Social Media Marketing:  Now, I'm an active guy and while I'm never standing still, my debut album, Never Standing Still,  has been doing just that - standing still!   Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and You Tube are some of the ways to successfully market yourself, but being visually impaired makes this even more of a challenge for me.   Social media support will produce traffic for my brand to be seen in order for me to develop a following of supporters as well as sales of my music.             

                           Social Media & Radio Airplay:  $3000.00 per month

                          Total Marketing Expense for 6 Months:  $18,000

                               

                                          TOTAL CROWDFUNDING GOAL:  $48,950

 

   HOW YOU CAN SUPPORT MY CAMPAIGN 

If you feel excited or moved by my story, there are so many different levels of support that you can offer.  Please give what your able - even the lowest pledge of $1 would be appreciated! For those who are able to pledge more and are also interested in a cool perk - check out the list on the right!

Whether able to give or not, I’d greatly appreciate it if you’d share my crowdfunding link below with your social circle through social media, email, etc.  Word of mouth can go a long way in the support of this campaign.

                  MY CROWDFUNDING LINK: https://igg.me/at/thethirdeyeproject

 

WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE

I’m offering some cool perks and you'll recieve periodic updates of the progress that we're making towards reaching our crowdfunding goal.  Once the campaign is over, I'll continue to share how the funds are being used with actual pictures and videos.  You'll be a part of this process every step of the way!   

                                                           RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There’s always a risk that I won’t reach the total crowdfunding amount.  Regardless of the support received, the funds will be used as planned. The challenge is that we’ll have to scale back on the ownership of some tracks, number of videos made, etc.  The money raised will be used to accomplish as much of my goal as possible. 

FINAL WORDS

Again, I humbly accept your supportive “hand up” whether it be financial,  well wishes or both.   I so very much appreciate you for having my back and taking this journey with me.  Your support is helping me get that much closer to realizing my goal of making a living as an independent artist!  I won't let you down!                                         

                                                                          Blessings & Stay Up!

                                                                          Brian - aka ThirdEye

story:
Introduction

Second Line Arts Collective is a 501(c)(3) Non-profit organization devoted to cultivating artistic excellence for students ages 15-23. Through a variety of programming, Second Line’s curriculum is designed to give aspiring creatives the tools necessary to succeed as artists and entrepreneurs. Traditionally, arts education programs focus solely on developing artist’s craft and technique. Today’s musicians are entrepreneurial artist, well versed in social media, marketing, branding, along with performance. Second Line Arts Collective aims to integrate arts education with the entrepreneurial skills necessary for a long and successful career in the arts. 

Sanaa Music Workshop is our premiere program. Most, if not all arts programs, ignore the monetization process and focus solely on performance and technical musical ability. For example, standard arts programs teach students how to paint, play, and create beautiful art but fail to teach students how to make a living using their skill sets. We are here to enrich this community with a different type of arts program. At Sanaa Music Workshop we bring in working professionals as well as business leaders that teach our students how to monetize there art. Through our lecture series our students have had the opportunity to learn from and build relationships with industry leaders. Grammy Award winning/nominated artist like Jamison Ross, and Donny Markowitz are among those who have taught our students so far. With your help we can continue to improve our students’ odds for a successful, lucrative and fulfilling career in the arts. 

How can I help?

By contributing to this project you will directly affect a student's life. We will use the funds collected to provide scholarships to students in need, financial aid, lunch, as well as paying for other operating expenses. Reduced rates and scholarship opportunities will be available to students who qualify because you have decided to be a part of the solution. Dismantling financial barriers for arts education is one of the many obstacles we can conquer with the support of people like you. In order to do these things, we need to raise 10,000 dollars. This money will help fund the 2019 workshop  and allow us to provide a high-quality educational experience for little to no cost to our students.    

Your Impact

Your contribution will help us prepare multiple generations of students for the challenges they will face in today's marketplace. Helping them to realize the potential they have for monetizing their creations and skill sets. By allowing students to apply their creativity to developing marketing, branding, and selling skills, we can eradicate the "Artist Myth". A line of thinking that relegates some artist to a life of poverty.

Other Ways You Can Help

You want to help, but may not be able to do it financially? No problem, there are a number of ways to help with this initiative, one of the first is to get the word out. Share with your friends, co-workers, social media followers, wherever and whoever you can think of. Help us spread the word about what Second Line Arts Collective is doing, and don't forget IndieGoGo has awesome share tools to help spread the message as well. Volunteers! We value the work and the energy that volunteers bring to the world. Community is a  valuable part of what and why we do the work that we do. Bring out your community groups to join us for two weeks of fun and excitement.  For more information, visit us at SecondLineArts.org. Looking for more information or have a question? See the FAQ.
story_txt:
Introduction
Second Line Arts Collective is a 501(c)(3) Non-profit organization devoted to cultivating artistic excellence for students ages 15-23. Through a variety of programming, Second Line’s curriculum is designed to give aspiring creatives the tools necessary to succeed as artists and entrepreneurs. Traditionally, arts education programs focus solely on developing artist’s craft and technique. Today’s musicians are entrepreneurial artist, well versed in social media, marketing, branding, along with performance. Second Line Arts Collective aims to integrate arts education with the entrepreneurial skills necessary for a long and successful career in the arts. 

Sanaa Music Workshop is our premiere program. Most, if not all arts programs, ignore the monetization process and focus solely on performance and technical musical ability. For example, standard arts programs teach students how to paint, play, and create beautiful art but fail to teach students how to make a living using their skill sets. We are here to enrich this community with a different type of arts program. At Sanaa Music Workshop we bring in working professionals as well as business leaders that teach our students how to monetize there art. Through our lecture series our students have had the opportunity to learn from and build relationships with industry leaders. Grammy Award winning/nominated artist like Jamison Ross, and Donny Markowitz are among those who have taught our students so far. With your help we can continue to improve our students’ odds for a successful, lucrative and fulfilling career in the arts. 
How can I help?
By contributing to this project you will directly affect a student's life. We will use the funds collected to provide scholarships to students in need, financial aid, lunch, as well as paying for other operating expenses. Reduced rates and scholarship opportunities will be available to students who qualify because you have decided to be a part of the solution. Dismantling financial barriers for arts education is one of the many obstacles we can conquer with the support of people like you. In order to do these things, we need to raise 10,000 dollars. This money will help fund the 2019 workshop  and allow us to provide a high-quality educational experience for little to no cost to our students.    
Your Impact
Your contribution will help us prepare multiple generations of students for the challenges they will face in today's marketplace. Helping them to realize the potential they have for monetizing their creations and skill sets. By allowing students to apply their creativity to developing marketing, branding, and selling skills, we can eradicate the "Artist Myth". A line of thinking that relegates some artist to a life of poverty.
Other Ways You Can Help
You want to help, but may not be able to do it financially? No problem, there are a number of ways to help with this initiative, one of the first is to get the word out. Share with your friends, co-workers, social media followers, wherever and whoever you can think of. Help us spread the word about what Second Line Arts Collective is doing, and don't forget IndieGoGo has awesome share tools to help spread the message as well. Volunteers! We value the work and the energy that volunteers bring to the world. Community is a  valuable part of what and why we do the work that we do. Bring out your community groups to join us for two weeks of fun and excitement.  For more information, visit us at SecondLineArts.org. Looking for more information or have a question? See the FAQ.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Steve McKenzie and I am passionate about the homeless in Chicago.  I work downtown and connect with them every day on my way to work.  In the course of these interactions, I’ve discovered some amazing people.  Willie Barbee is one of those people.  He is currently homeless, but he loves to sing for commuters on their way to work.  He is a wonderful soul.  My goal for this campaign is to make Willie some money so he doesn’t have to sleep in the shelter AND to make Willie feel loved by all of us!

What We Need & What You Get

I would like to raise at least $500 with this campaign.  The "digital download" of the song requires no cost to produce.  The CDs will cost between $2 and $2.50 to produce, with the benefit being that any extra CDs that aren't sold Willie can sell himself.  Plus, the CD will be a tangible reminder of Willie and others experiencing homelessness that people care about them and that there is hope.  The song has already been recorded and the disc artwork has been created, so once the campaign ends we'll be able to send our project to the CD replication company right away.  

The Impact

You will change Willie's life.  Even if all we do is meet the $500 goal, Willie will have money in his pocket and the realization that he is loved by all of us.  The last campaign I began helped a homeless author publish a book.  So I know we can do this...

Risks & Challenges

Given the simplicity of this project (a one song CD)/digital download, there really is only one risk and that is that the disc replication company takes longer than expected to produce the CD (which is highly unlikely)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give, you can still make Willie's dream come true--simply share this project with like-minded folks and others you know who might be interested.
