story:
How to Play Guitar in Easiest & Fastest way

Halo. We are G&M Guitars. G&M Guitars are Grizaldi and Meliani. We are from Indonesia. We made video for Youtube since 2014. We made video about Guitar Cover and Original Song too. We have a band named Helaragon. The genre is Metal and we combined it with Sundanese traditional music.

Many people asked us why we can play guitar so well, some asked us to teach them, and then the others asked us to make a guitar lesson video. So, we just want to make their wishes happen. So they can learn guitar fast & easily. If you help us to reach our goals on Indiegogo, that means you helped them to make this guitar lesson video happen.

When this lesson video happen, we will upload some Parts of this video which everyone can access it for free, but they can't watch this full video for free. But if you're help us on indiegogo, you can get full video and other content (you can see on perks list), far before we upload some part of it on youtube. So you will be the first peoples who watch our video.

What's In Our Lesson Video?

We make this video for beginners whom wanted to be able to play guitar but they don't know how to learn and always had trouble whenever learning guitar. Because yeah, it's hard. We want to tell some method that make they can play guitar easier. The guitar lesson video include:

  • Guitar introduction
  • Fingering
  • How to read chord charts
  • Chords they should know
  • How to read tabs
  • Guitar scale
  • Etc.

This video will be around 60 - 90 minutes.

Where Will the Funding Go?

We want to make this video in very good quality than our previous videos on Youtube so it'll be a watchable and enjoyfull guitar lesson video.

If we reached our goals, we want to buy Music & Studio equipments such as Guitar Pick ups, Mirrorles Camera, Video Mic, Portable Mic, LED Lightning, Action Cam, etc. So, it's not only for this video but also for our next video.

What You Get

If you help us for this campaign, it means indirectly you help us make our video quality to be better than before. And you'll get not only this video but also you'll get our files from G&M Guitars Patreon account such as Guitar Tabs, Backing Tracks, and Helaragon EP Download. You'll get behind the scene video and your name will be on video credit. You can see the perks list.

How If We Don't Reach The Entire Goal?

If we don't reach the  entire goal, we will keep make the video but the video wouldn't be as what we planned. Maybe the video quality will be kinda worse than the expectation. And the audio will not in high quality, so maybe the video will not be watchable and enjoyable.

But if we get more than our goal, i'm pretty sure the video will be better than what we've planned. Maybe we can make 4K video. That'll be awesome!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you interested to our upcoming project but you can't donate a single perks, you can help us by:

  • You can be G&M Guitar's Patron. You can pledge starting from $1 https://www.patreon.com/gandmguitars
  • Watch G&M Guitars videos on Youtube and click every single ads that appears, so it'll grow our revenue 
  • Suggest this campaign to your friends, or people around you who can help donate
  • Share on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc so more people can find this campaign

If we don't reach the  entire goal, we will keep make the video but the video wouldn't be as what we planned. Maybe the video quality will be kinda worse than the expectation. And the audio will not in high quality, so maybe the video will not be watchable and enjoyable.
But if we get more than our goal, i'm pretty sure the video will be better than what we've planned. Maybe we can make 4K video. That'll be awesome!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
If you interested to our upcoming project but you can't donate a single perks, you can help us by:

You can be G&M Guitar's Patron. You can pledge starting from $1 https://www.patreon.com/gandmguitars

Watch G&M Guitars videos on Youtube and click every single ads that appears, so it'll grow our revenue 
Suggest this campaign to your friends, or people around you who can help donate
Share on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc so more people can find this campaign

story:
Who I am

My name is Murat, I am a design director & digital entrepeneur of 7 years based in Hackney, East London. I have helped launch products & advertising at over 50 golliath brands such as Coca Cola, American Express and many more. Before being placed into the product & advertising industry, I had a very humble and working class upbringing. Growing up in Hackney was once a very rough experience but now it's pretty different and calm with charming record shops and great coffee. Living here all my life I experienced a whole new world of cultures, foods and sounds that I have never ignored but only inherited.

Music for me has always been a number one passion and my taste for it has constantly been free, I believe this is due to growing up in a very racially mixed environment where different sounds were always around. When you open the doors to music from around the world, you get blown away with what artists can do with local instruments, ancient vocals and modern incorporations. By coming to IndieGOGO, I want to finally share these feelings and sensations with the world by combining my knowledge of international music with my expertise in the Entrepreneurial, Design & Product industry.

 

The Idea

I have been a lover of music from a very young age, music has never been a mere sound that vibrates within my ear canals but a plethora of emotional feelings. To me it has been a journey, an experience that drifts me to another world which an artist has created exclusively for me at that moment. With mixblock I wan't everyone to get that hair on end feeling everytime I find a new artist that emotionally reacts with me.

The problem lies with traction and reach. There are so many artists out there that are mind blowing, but unfortunately the music industry never showcases real talent like them. We all love streaming technology, the practicality and ease of it can be very useful but new or foreign artists can even still be very hard to find for a western audience, an addition to this it's difficult to give their story with no physicality behind the sound.

Sales of vinyl in 2016 reached a 25-year high with over a 1000% increase as consumers young and old have once again embraced physical formats of music, we wan't to emphasize this by giving you the very best of it, delivered to your door. Beautifully curated and thoroughly explained to you, what you are receiving, where it's from and why it's so special.

 

What We Need

We wan't to spend as much of your funding on music as possible to give the very best auditory experience upon unwrapping the first box. Luckily with our experience in business & digital design we are able to forward 70% of the fundings to the music as we are very proffecient at handling the production aspects. We are also be providing a beautiful 10 page magazine which will be developed & published with no funding. The plan is as follows:

£8000 with current conversion rate = $9770.4

$1000 - Website Development

$500 - Box preparation & purchase costs

$1400 - IndieGOGO & payment processing fees

 

What You Get

With the subscription box, you will get:

  • 1 xMixBlock Magazine
  • 1 x Limited Edition CD with Sleeve
  • 1 x 6"/12" Vinyl Record
  • 1 x Random 6"/12" Vinyl Record, CD or Cassette
  • 1 x Hi-Res Full Album Download Code
  • Bonus Item 1 x Musical Documentary DVD/Bluray or Vinyl.

The music can be from anywhere around the world and range vastly in genres such as Modern Electronica to 70's Funk.

 

The Impact

With MixBlock, we want to truly impact the music industry as well as the subscription. Instead of giving so much to companies & artists that are already huge, let's give the little or lesser known artists a space where they can let themselves be heard worldwide on a beautiful physical form.

With MixBlock you are guaranteed to:

  • Get your moneys worth.
  • Find new genre's you never thought you would enjoy.
  • Give talented up and coming artists a chance.
  • Experience sounds from the world, from African to Middle-Eastern to Balkan.
  • Hear fusion sounds, from experimental artists.
  • Read interesting articles about musicians you never see or read in western publications.
  • Get physical music in beautifully printed releases.
  • Discover excentric and fascinating new artists from our 10 page magazine (with QR codes linking directly to the artists Spotify account).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help MixBlock launch even quicker by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers.

 

WE WILL BE SHIPPING GLOBALLY.

 

INSTAGRAM

We are nothing like our competitors who are in it for the money, our aim from concept is to broaden your musical knowledge and let you as the consumer delve deep into sound you may never have heard before.

You will absolutely never receive music that you can just find anywhere or in any old record store! Every single person will receive the same music in which we will give our blood if needed in curating every month.

Thank you and much love from MixBlock.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Patti Paige.

I've been creating new songs inspired by my journeys - both as a child and an adult. Many of these journeys have been around the world to moving places, many more have been around my head impelling me to change.

After escaping the constraints of a so called 'normal' life, bringing up my children in a challenging relationship, I have found a new freedom through  music.

And what a freedom it has been! This year I was whisked away to Sweden to record an album, and now I would love to release this - not only for the entertaing original music, but to say thank you to those that have made it possible; and to say to everyone, anything is possible. Escape is possible. New lives are possible.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise the money to duplicate the CD and covers. Anyone supporting me can either get a heartfelt THANK YOU or else a signed copy of the CD with other extras if you like - take a look at the perks.

The Impact

Your support will make the difference between my album being a thing of reality instead of just a dream.

Risks & Challenges

Not a lot is required. If I don't raise the full target I will at least be able to release a limited run.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's horrible asking for money, so I've tried to ensure that all support gets a good reward - but even if you can't offer financial help please do consider sharing the campaign. Even a simple share is most helpful

story:
Welcome to Mananabango's Campaign!

Hello, good people! We are Mananabango! For those of you that have never heard of us, we are an Independent Rock band from Louisville, Ky. We try to use our music as a platform to explore all facets of the type of sounds that inspire us from Rock of all decades to country, from punk to folk, from metal to gospel and just about anything else. We try to bring all this into a sound that could only be described with one word... Mananabango! We started as a husband and wife playing music together in our parent's guest room, and we hope to bring that kind of authentic love to something you can listen to.

The Campaign:

Here is what we are looking to accomplish. We have been painstakingly recording and producing our second album and so far we couldn't be happier with the results. We started walking ourselves through the process of when we released our first album and this is when we realized if we were going to get the final product out, we were going to need to ask for help.

We have set the campaign goal at $5000. Here are the things that this money will fund:

  • Recording equipment overhauls: Hardware and Software ($850)
  • CD Mastering and Manufacturing ($1500)
  • Music Video production costs ($1100)
  • Book a small tour to help promote the album ($1000)
  • Digital Advertising campaign ($550)

If we exceed the goal we will use the extra money to produce another music video for a third song, as a good deal of those are capital expenses and can be used toward another video. If we fail to reach this goal it will force us to reduce the size of the tour to compensate as well as bleed down the spending from the Marketing/Advertising budget.

Our Hope:

Making music is a process that means so much for us. It is a way for us to connect with all types of people and reach out in a world that is becoming more and more disjointed by the day. We have a deep heritage in real, honest, music, and we want everyone to be a part of that. Technology has allowed people to bring art to market in ways that were unimaginable even decades ago. We want to touch lives through the shared experience of music.

We have been on this merry-go-round before and we learned so much putting out our first album. Among the things we learned is that no band is an island. Our successes so far have not been due to our hard work or talent, it was through the connections we made to fans, and to the network of supportive people that want to help bring your creative vision to life. This is because, ultimately, the music doesn't belong to us; music is universal, and we share the feeling it creates in the imaginations of people who hear it, and that is what we want to create, a human connection.

Ways to Help

We obviously are asking for monetary assistance, and we don't do this lightly. Musicians as a group are not generally the most affluent, so, we understand the gravity of asking for donations. If you don't have the means to donate, you can still contribute! Please share this campaign with your friends and family, and talk with them about why supporting independent music is so important. Every little bit counts, and we appreciate you taking the time to even look at this campaign.

If you do decide to donate, we want to sincerely thank you for your generosity, and we hope to make the rewards generous and interesting so you feel you get your moneys worth.

Thanks in advance,

Mananabango!

story:
O Festivalu 

DORTJOL FESTIVAL je  festival mešovitog muzičkog žanra. Na DORTJOL FESTIVALU će od 26. juna do 1. Jula, sastati 27 muzičara iz Srbije i inostranstva, poznati po svojim nastupima u svetu džeza, etno i klasične muzike.

Kroz radionice, master klasove, snimanja sešna, serije koncerata, želimo da DORTJOL FESTIVAL postane jedinstvena platforma za kulturnu razmenu, muzičko obrazovanje i na taj način obogatimo kulturni život Beograda. 

DORTJOL FESTIVAL je, kao i beogradski kvart Dorćol, dobio naziv od turske reči “Dört yol“ što u prevodu znači raskrsnica. Tokom 5 festivalskih dana, želimo da stvaramo “novu harmoniju na raskršću” bogatu zvukom i istoka i zapada.

Na DORTJOL FESTIVALU će nastupati Lula Pena (Portugalija), Ansambl Lale (Gruzija), Dragana Tomić i prijatelji (Srbija), Timios Acakas (Grčka), Iva Jovanović, Tamara Aleksić, Branislava Podrumac, Vladimir Andrić (Srbija), Agios Lavrentios bras bend (Novi Zeland, Grčka, Nemačka, Italija, Španija) i ad hoc band Berlin-Belgrade dub konekcija (Srbija i Nemačka) . 

About the Festival

DORTJOL FESTIVAL is cross-genre music festival. From June 26th to July 1st, 27 musicians from Serbia and abroad, well known for their perfomances in world of Jazz, world music and classical music, will will meet in Belgrade and participate on DORTJOL FESTIVAL. 

Through the workshops, masterclasses, recording sessions and live concerts, we want to make DORTJOL FESTIVAL to be a unique platform of cultural exchange, musical education and to enrich the cultural life of Belgrade. 

Like the Belgrade neighborhood of Dorćol, our festival’s name derived from turkish word “Dört yol“, which litteraly means “crossroad”. During the 5 festival days we want to create “new harmony on the crossroad” rich with sounds from the East and the West. 

Musicians performing on DORTJOL FESTIVAL are: Lula Pena (PT), Ensamble Lale (GE), Dragana Tomic and friends (SRB), Thimios Atzakas (GR), Iva Jovanović, Tamara Aleksic, Branislava Po- drumac, Vladimir Andric (SRB), Agios Lavrentios Brass Band (NZ, GR, DE, ES, ITA), and ad hoc band Berlin-Belgrade Dub Connection. 

 

Organizatori / Organizers

FONDACIJA ABARID

Fondacija Abarid je neprofitna i nevladina organizacija za razvoj audio-vizuelnog i literalnog stvaralaštva. Od 2013. godine aktivno delujemo u promovisanju zaštite i unapređenju umetnosti, nauke i obrazovanja, kulture i javnog informisanja, evropskih integracija, međunarodnog i međukulturnog razumevanja.

Od osnivanja smo organizovali i producirali više pozorišnih predstava, muzičkih događaja, izložbi i filmova, u saradnji sa preko 300 umetnika iz Srbije i sveta.

ART FOUNDATION ABARID 

Art Foundation Abarid is non-profit and non-governmental organization for development of audio- visual and litteral art. Since 2013 we are active in promotion of protection and improvement of art, science, education, culture and public information, European education and international and intercultural understanding. 

Since the establishment of our foundation, we have organized and produced many theatre plays, music events, exhibitions and films, in cooperation with more than 300 artists from Serbia and abroad. 

Balkanska Akademija za Muziku

Balkanska Akademija za muziku (BAM), je neformalna grupa koju od 2016. godine vodi Hejden Čisholm sa ciljem stvaranja veza među muzičarima balkanskih zemalja sa muzičarima iz drugih evropskih zemalja. BAM je u januaru 2017. godine u saradnji sa Fondacijom Abarid u saradnji sa GOETHE institutom organizovao prvi Plašmjuzik festival u Beogradu, na kojima su nastupali renomirani muzičari i muzički sastavi poput Zijada Radžaba iz Sirije, Omodernt gudački kvartet iz Švedske, a koji je posetilo 550 ljudi, a dva koncerta iz Studija 6 RTB, su imali i direktan prenos na RTS 3.

Balkan Academy of Music 

Balkan Academy of Music is informal group, led by Hayden Chisholm since 2016 with aim to enhance the connections between musicians from Balkan and other European countries. In Jaunary 2017, in cooperation with Art Foundation Abarid and GOETHE Institute, BAM organized the first edition of PlushMusic Festival in Belgrade, on which the reknowned musicians and musical groups, such is Ziad Rajab (Syria) and Omodernt Quaetet (Sweeden) had participated. The festival was seen by 550 people, and two concerts form Studio 6 of Radio Belgrade, were broadcasted live on RTS3. 

 

Umetnički Direktor

Hejden Čisholm je saksofonista, kompozitor i multi-instrumentalista sa Novog Zelanda. Iako u svom stvaralaštvu dotiče razne žanrove muzike, u svetu je najviše prepoznatljiv po džezu, improvizacijama i savremenoj klasičnoj muzici. 

Toko svoje bogate karijere je izdao više od 30 albuma, a učestvovao je i na 50-ak albuma drugih umetnika. Godine 2013. objavio je boks set od 13 diskova “13 Views of the Heart's Cargo”, sa kojim je u Nemačkoj osvojio prestižnu nagradu SWR Jazz Prize. Godine 2016. je Fondacija Moontower  izdala je njegov drugi boks set od 13 diskova “Cups of Oblivion”.

Hejden trentutno živi u Beogradu, gde radi na nekoliko projekata u sferi muzičke edukacije i kulturne razmene.

Art Director

Hayden Chisholm is a New Zealand saxophonist, composer, and multi-instrumentalist. His work has touched on a wide range of musical genres but he is best known for his jazz, improvised and contemporary classical music. 

During his career, Hayden released more than 30 albums and participated in 50 more. In 2013 he released the 13 CD Box Set "13 Views of the Heart's Cargo" which earned him the German SWR Jazz Prize. In 2016 he released his second 13 CD Box Set "Cusp of Oblivion" on the Moontower Foundation Edition. 

Hayden currently resides in Belgrade, Serbia, where he is woking on several projects in area of musical education and cultural exchange. 

Šta želimo da postignemo?

Koncept DORTJOL FESTIVALA zasniva se na ideji da se umetnicima iz inostranstva pruža prilika dužeg boravka u glavnom gradu Srbije, Beogradu, tačnije na beogradskom kvartu Dorćolu,  tokom kojeg će u međusobnim susretima i susretima sa lokalnim muzičarima i građanima, razmeniti svoja muzička znanja, iskustva i kulturu.

Mi ne želimo da DORTJOL FESTIVAL bude događaj na koji će muzičari samo doći, odsvirati i otići. Kroz realizaciju DORTJOL FESTIVALA, želimo da Dorćol, Beograd i Srbija bude mesto sastanka, mesto interakcije, mesto gde će muzičari i građani učiti jedni od drugih.

U cilju realizacije ovog koncepta, obezbedili smo $9,250 vrednu podršku u finansijama i uslugama, kroz podršku od prijatelja DORTJOL FESTIVALA (Gete institut Srbije, Jahting klub "Kej", Supermarket Conceptstore) i privatne donacije.

Podršku koju smo do sada dobili omogućila nam je da:

  • Pokrijemo deo putnih troškova i nadoknade za muzičare
  • Obezbedimo prostore za koncerte (Jazz Club Mihailo Miša Blam, Dorćolsko narodno pozorište, KC Grad)
  • Osiguramo opremu potrebnu za koncerte
  • Organizujemo otvaranje festivala na brodu za predstavnike medija, prijatelje DORTJOL FESTIVALA, i donatore 
  • Oglašavamo festival
  • Obezbedimo muzičarima koji dolaze iz inostranstva organizovane obilaske Beograda
  • Ugostimo muzičare, kako priliči, sa autentičnom srpskom kuhinjom

Naš cilj je da uz vašu pomoć prikupimo dodatnih $4,600 donacija, kako bismo u potpunosti realizovali koncept DORTJOL FESTIVALA.

What We Want to Achieve? 

Concept of DORTJOL FESTIVAL is based on the idea to provide the chance of longer stay in Belgrade, Serbia, more precisely in Dorcol, to artists coming from different countries, where they will exchange their musical knowledge, experience and culture with Serbian musicians and the people of Belgrade. We have planned the programs of cultural exchange, musical education and recording sessions during the 5 festival days, as well as 6 live concerts. 

We don’t want to make DORTJOL FESTIVAL a festival where musicians will just arrive to perform and leave. Through the realization of DORTJOL FESTIVAL, we want to make Dorćol, Belgrade and Serbia to be a place of the meeting, place of interaction, place where the musicians and citizen will learn from each other. 

To achieve this, we have already managed to secure $9,250 worth of support in fundings and services, through the support of the of the Friends of DORTJOL FESTIVAL (Goethe Institute Serbia, Yachting Club “Kej”, Supermarket Conceptstore) and private donations. 

Support we have received so far has enabled us to: 

  • Cover the part of the costs for travel costs and fees for the musicians 
  • Secure venues for the live concerts (Jazz club Mihailo Misa Blam, Dorćolsko Narodno Pozoriste, KC Grad) 
  • Secure the equipment needed for live concerts 
  • Organize the opening event on the cruiser boat for the representatives of media, friends of DORTJOL FESTIVAL, donors and supporters 
  • PR the event 
  • Provide musicians coming from abroad with guided tours of Belgrade 
  • Provide musicians with authentic Serbian food and cuisine during the festival from the green markets of Belgrade

Our goal is to raise additional $4,600 of donations in order to fully realize the concept of DORTJOL FESTIVAL.

Šta nam treba od vas?

Cilj naše kampanje je da prikupimo $4,600. Vaša podrška će nam omogućiti da: 

  • Pokrijemo deo putnih troškova i nadoknada za muzičare ($2,300) 
  • Platimo produkciju visoko kvalitetnog audio-vizuelnog snimanja 4 kratka koncerta “Sastanak na  Dorćolu”,  koji će kasnije biti objavljeni na veb-sajtu DORTJOL FESTIVALA. Ovo snimanje će ujedno biti i besplatne edukativne radionice za inžinjere zvuka, koje ce voditi Robert Nacken. ($1,200) 
  • Organizujemo besplatne masterklasove koju će voditi Hajden Čisholm, za talentovane saksofoniste iz Srbije. ($450)
  • Organizujemo besplatne radionice tradicionalne muzike Balkana. ($450) 
  • Porkijemo dnevne troškove 5 volontera, koji će nam pomažu u organizaciji i realizaciji DORTJOL FESTIVALA ($200)

Verujemo da uz vašu pomoć možemo ostvariti cilj DORTJOL FESTIVAL-a i zajedno stvoriti "novu harmoniju na raskršću". 

What We Need From You

The goal of our campaign is to collect $4,600. This money will enable us to: 

  • Cover the part of travel costs and fees for musicians ($2,300) 
  • Produce 4 high quality recording sessions “Meeting at Dorćol”, which will be recorded and filmed in high quality, and later posted on web-site of the DORTJOL FESTIVAL. These sessions will also be free-of-charge educational workshops for sound-engineers, led by Robert Nacken. ($1,200) 
  • Organize free-of-charge master classes for Saxophone led by Hayden Chisholm ($450), for talented young Serbian saxophone players 
  • Organize free-of-charge workshops of traditional music from Balkans ($450) 
  • Cover the daily costs of 5 volunteers, helping us out in organization and realisation of the DORTJOL FESTIVAL ($200)

We believe that with your help we can reach the goals of DORTJOL FESTIVAL and create “new harmony on the crossroad”. 

Kako još možete da nam pomognete?

Ako niste u mogućnosti da donirate i tako pomognete našoj kampanji, šerujte je na fejsbuku i podelite sa vašim prijateljima. Obavestite ih o DORTJOL FESTIVALU!

How Can You Help Us? 

If you can't back our campaign by claiming one of the perks, please share it with your friends. Let them know about the DORTJOL FESTIVAL!
story_txt:
O Festivalu 
DORTJOL FESTIVAL je  festival mešovitog muzičkog žanra. Na DORTJOL FESTIVALU će od 26. juna do 1. Jula, sastati 27 muzičara iz Srbije i inostranstva, poznati po svojim nastupima u svetu džeza, etno i klasične muzike.
Kroz radionice, master klasove, snimanja sešna, serije koncerata, želimo da DORTJOL FESTIVAL postane jedinstvena platforma za kulturnu razmenu, muzičko obrazovanje i na taj način obogatimo kulturni život Beograda. 
DORTJOL FESTIVAL je, kao i beogradski kvart Dorćol, dobio naziv od turske reči “Dört yol“ što u prevodu znači raskrsnica. Tokom 5 festivalskih dana, želimo da stvaramo “novu harmoniju na raskršću” bogatu zvukom i istoka i zapada.
Na DORTJOL FESTIVALU će nastupati Lula Pena (Portugalija), Ansambl Lale (Gruzija), Dragana Tomić i prijatelji (Srbija), Timios Acakas (Grčka), Iva Jovanović, Tamara Aleksić, Branislava Podrumac, Vladimir Andrić (Srbija), Agios Lavrentios bras bend (Novi Zeland, Grčka, Nemačka, Italija, Španija) i ad hoc band Berlin-Belgrade dub konekcija (Srbija i Nemačka) . 
About the Festival
DORTJOL FESTIVAL is cross-genre music festival. From June 26th to July 1st, 27 musicians from Serbia and abroad, well known for their perfomances in world of Jazz, world music and classical music, will will meet in Belgrade and participate on DORTJOL FESTIVAL. 
Through the workshops, masterclasses, recording sessions and live concerts, we want to make DORTJOL FESTIVAL to be a unique platform of cultural exchange, musical education and to enrich the cultural life of Belgrade. 
Like the Belgrade neighborhood of Dorćol, our festival’s name derived from turkish word “Dört yol“, which litteraly means “crossroad”. During the 5 festival days we want to create “new harmony on the crossroad” rich with sounds from the East and the West. 
Musicians performing on DORTJOL FESTIVAL are: Lula Pena (PT), Ensamble Lale (GE), Dragana Tomic and friends (SRB), Thimios Atzakas (GR), Iva Jovanović, Tamara Aleksic, Branislava Po- drumac, Vladimir Andric (SRB), Agios Lavrentios Brass Band (NZ, GR, DE, ES, ITA), and ad hoc band Berlin-Belgrade Dub Connection. 
 

Organizatori / Organizers


FONDACIJA ABARID
Fondacija Abarid je neprofitna i nevladina organizacija za razvoj audio-vizuelnog i literalnog stvaralaštva. Od 2013. godine aktivno delujemo u promovisanju zaštite i unapređenju umetnosti, nauke i obrazovanja, kulture i javnog informisanja, evropskih integracija, međunarodnog i međukulturnog razumevanja.
Od osnivanja smo organizovali i producirali više pozorišnih predstava, muzičkih događaja, izložbi i filmova, u saradnji sa preko 300 umetnika iz Srbije i sveta.
ART FOUNDATION ABARID 
Art Foundation Abarid is non-profit and non-governmental organization for development of audio- visual and litteral art. Since 2013 we are active in promotion of protection and improvement of art, science, education, culture and public information, European education and international and intercultural understanding. 
Since the establishment of our foundation, we have organized and produced many theatre plays, music events, exhibitions and films, in cooperation with more than 300 artists from Serbia and abroad. 
Balkanska Akademija za Muziku

Balkanska Akademija za muziku (BAM), je neformalna grupa koju od 2016. godine vodi Hejden Čisholm sa ciljem stvaranja veza među muzičarima balkanskih zemalja sa muzičarima iz drugih evropskih zemalja. BAM je u januaru 2017. godine u saradnji sa Fondacijom Abarid u saradnji sa GOETHE institutom organizovao prvi Plašmjuzik festival u Beogradu, na kojima su nastupali renomirani muzičari i muzički sastavi poput Zijada Radžaba iz Sirije, Omodernt gudački kvartet iz Švedske, a koji je posetilo 550 ljudi, a dva koncerta iz Studija 6 RTB, su imali i direktan prenos na RTS 3.

Balkan Academy of Music 
Balkan Academy of Music is informal group, led by Hayden Chisholm since 2016 with aim to enhance the connections between musicians from Balkan and other European countries. In Jaunary 2017, in cooperation with Art Foundation Abarid and GOETHE Institute, BAM organized the first edition of PlushMusic Festival in Belgrade, on which the reknowned musicians and musical groups, such is Ziad Rajab (Syria) and Omodernt Quaetet (Sweeden) had participated. The festival was seen by 550 people, and two concerts form Studio 6 of Radio Belgrade, were broadcasted live on RTS3. 
 

Umetnički Direktor
Hejden Čisholm je saksofonista, kompozitor i multi-instrumentalista sa Novog Zelanda. Iako u svom stvaralaštvu dotiče razne žanrove muzike, u svetu je najviše prepoznatljiv po džezu, improvizacijama i savremenoj klasičnoj muzici. 
Toko svoje bogate karijere je izdao više od 30 albuma, a učestvovao je i na 50-ak albuma drugih umetnika. Godine 2013. objavio je boks set od 13 diskova “13 Views of the Heart's Cargo”, sa kojim je u Nemačkoj osvojio prestižnu nagradu SWR Jazz Prize. Godine 2016. je Fondacija Moontower  izdala je njegov drugi boks set od 13 diskova “Cups of Oblivion”.
Hejden trentutno živi u Beogradu, gde radi na nekoliko projekata u sferi muzičke edukacije i kulturne razmene.
Art Director
Hayden Chisholm is a New Zealand saxophonist, composer, and multi-instrumentalist. His work has touched on a wide range of musical genres but he is best known for his jazz, improvised and contemporary classical music. 
During his career, Hayden released more than 30 albums and participated in 50 more. In 2013 he released the 13 CD Box Set "13 Views of the Heart's Cargo" which earned him the German SWR Jazz Prize. In 2016 he released his second 13 CD Box Set "Cusp of Oblivion" on the Moontower Foundation Edition. 
Hayden currently resides in Belgrade, Serbia, where he is woking on several projects in area of musical education and cultural exchange. 
Šta želimo da postignemo?
Koncept DORTJOL FESTIVALA zasniva se na ideji da se umetnicima iz inostranstva pruža prilika dužeg boravka u glavnom gradu Srbije, Beogradu, tačnije na beogradskom kvartu Dorćolu,  tokom kojeg će u međusobnim susretima i susretima sa lokalnim muzičarima i građanima, razmeniti svoja muzička znanja, iskustva i kulturu.
Mi ne želimo da DORTJOL FESTIVAL bude događaj na koji će muzičari samo doći, odsvirati i otići. Kroz realizaciju DORTJOL FESTIVALA, želimo da Dorćol, Beograd i Srbija bude mesto sastanka, mesto interakcije, mesto gde će muzičari i građani učiti jedni od drugih.
U cilju realizacije ovog koncepta, obezbedili smo $9,250 vrednu podršku u finansijama i uslugama, kroz podršku od prijatelja DORTJOL FESTIVALA (Gete institut Srbije, Jahting klub "Kej", Supermarket Conceptstore) i privatne donacije.
Podršku koju smo do sada dobili omogućila nam je da:

Pokrijemo deo putnih troškova i nadoknade za muzičare
Obezbedimo prostore za koncerte (Jazz Club Mihailo Miša Blam, Dorćolsko narodno pozorište, KC Grad)
Osiguramo opremu potrebnu za koncerte
Organizujemo otvaranje festivala na brodu za predstavnike medija, prijatelje DORTJOL FESTIVALA, i donatore 
Oglašavamo festival
Obezbedimo muzičarima koji dolaze iz inostranstva organizovane obilaske Beograda
Ugostimo muzičare, kako priliči, sa autentičnom srpskom kuhinjom

Naš cilj je da uz vašu pomoć prikupimo dodatnih $4,600 donacija, kako bismo u potpunosti realizovali koncept DORTJOL FESTIVALA.
What We Want to Achieve? 
Concept of DORTJOL FESTIVAL is based on the idea to provide the chance of longer stay in Belgrade, Serbia, more precisely in Dorcol, to artists coming from different countries, where they will exchange their musical knowledge, experience and culture with Serbian musicians and the people of Belgrade. We have planned the programs of cultural exchange, musical education and recording sessions during the 5 festival days, as well as 6 live concerts. 
We don’t want to make DORTJOL FESTIVAL a festival where musicians will just arrive to perform and leave. Through the realization of DORTJOL FESTIVAL, we want to make Dorćol, Belgrade and Serbia to be a place of the meeting, place of interaction, place where the musicians and citizen will learn from each other. 
To achieve this, we have already managed to secure $9,250 worth of support in fundings and services, through the support of the of the Friends of DORTJOL FESTIVAL (Goethe Institute Serbia, Yachting Club “Kej”, Supermarket Conceptstore) and private donations. 
Support we have received so far has enabled us to: 

Cover the part of the costs for travel costs and fees for the musicians 
Secure venues for the live concerts (Jazz club Mihailo Misa Blam, Dorćolsko Narodno Pozoriste, KC Grad) 
Secure the equipment needed for live concerts 
Organize the opening event on the cruiser boat for the representatives of media, friends of DORTJOL FESTIVAL, donors and supporters 
PR the event 
Provide musicians coming from abroad with guided tours of Belgrade 
Provide musicians with authentic Serbian food and cuisine during the festival from the green markets of Belgrade

Our goal is to raise additional $4,600 of donations in order to fully realize the concept of DORTJOL FESTIVAL.

Šta nam treba od vas?
Cilj naše kampanje je da prikupimo $4,600. Vaša podrška će nam omogućiti da: 

Pokrijemo deo putnih troškova i nadoknada za muzičare ($2,300) 
Platimo produkciju visoko kvalitetnog audio-vizuelnog snimanja 4 kratka koncerta “Sastanak na  Dorćolu”,  koji će kasnije biti objavljeni na veb-sajtu DORTJOL FESTIVALA. Ovo snimanje će ujedno biti i besplatne edukativne radionice za inžinjere zvuka, koje ce voditi Robert Nacken. ($1,200) 
Organizujemo besplatne masterklasove koju će voditi Hajden Čisholm, za talentovane saksofoniste iz Srbije. ($450)
Organizujemo besplatne radionice tradicionalne muzike Balkana. ($450) 
Porkijemo dnevne troškove 5 volontera, koji će nam pomažu u organizaciji i realizaciji DORTJOL FESTIVALA ($200)

Verujemo da uz vašu pomoć možemo ostvariti cilj DORTJOL FESTIVAL-a i zajedno stvoriti "novu harmoniju na raskršću". 
What We Need From You
The goal of our campaign is to collect $4,600. This money will enable us to: 

Cover the part of travel costs and fees for musicians ($2,300) 
Produce 4 high quality recording sessions “Meeting at Dorćol”, which will be recorded and filmed in high quality, and later posted on web-site of the DORTJOL FESTIVAL. These sessions will also be free-of-charge educational workshops for sound-engineers, led by Robert Nacken. ($1,200) 
Organize free-of-charge master classes for Saxophone led by Hayden Chisholm ($450), for talented young Serbian saxophone players 
Organize free-of-charge workshops of traditional music from Balkans ($450) 
Cover the daily costs of 5 volunteers, helping us out in organization and realisation of the DORTJOL FESTIVAL ($200)

We believe that with your help we can reach the goals of DORTJOL FESTIVAL and create “new harmony on the crossroad”. 

Kako još možete da nam pomognete?
Ako niste u mogućnosti da donirate i tako pomognete našoj kampanji, šerujte je na fejsbuku i podelite sa vašim prijateljima. Obavestite ih o DORTJOL FESTIVALU!
How Can You Help Us? If you can't back our campaign by claiming one of the perks, please share it with your friends. Let them know about the DORTJOL FESTIVAL!

story:
and the violin plays a.....

BLUE SYMPHONY


Going into hiding for a year and half Jeremy has retreated into a writing studio
in London to demo and write (yes he actually writes down every song)
with his trademark pound shop markers

Starting fake bands and playing a few select shows in London and Paris to try out material, Jeremy has been breaking free of the Lp/touring cycle that traps so many bands to really buckle down and write instead of being pressured by labels and agents (and himself) to tour and release records. Instead devoting himself to the craft of writing. So that when he does go out it is full of energy, excitement and for the love of it

After recording 70 plus songs in demo form on a dubious broken 8 track, Some just acoustic, some with various friends; Robin from Male Bonding, James Hoare from Veronica falls / Ultimate painting, Charlie from Crocodiles, Alban Claudin from Paris and Tony Harewood, one of Jeremys best friends and long time collaborator a la (Splash, Abandoned Apartments)

As well as an Album, Jeremy has written a short film for the album as a visual
companion. To be Shot on the Foggy streets of London and in the black forest
of England.


Where we want to record!

We want to record at KONK studios in London (owned by Ray Davies of the KINKS)

on 2 inch tape mix to tape and then straight to vinyl

KONK is one of the last great independent studio left in London and has recorded

great albums over the years, helping fund this project in turn helps KONK as well!


Album Costs

  • 750 pounds a day plus 200 pounds a day for an engineer
  • My goal is 8 days studio time
  • 200 pounds per reel of tape X 3
  • 1600 pounds to press 1000 copies of vinyl
  • 159 pounds per 100 posters
  • 200 pounds per 100 cassettes


Risks and Challenges


Vinyl takes time to make :) but its fun!!!
the reason is the demand is higher than the supply of pressing plants
The challenges are that it will be a maximum 6 month turnaround
on Vinyl pressed with a minimum of 3 months
We will keep up to date everyone who has ordered to the exact date
as we hand in the masters to the Pressing plant
We ask to please be patient as this is a very fun process to get the final
result in the mail on the day of delivery

If we are unable to record at KONK because of not enough money is raised then there are cheaper options
One of them being to record at Vogue studios in Paris
they still have a 2 inch 24 track tape machine and 2 track mix machine

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find yourself not being able to contribute in a financial way towards the production of this album then please share and help get the word out there via sharing on social media
:)

story:
Hi, all ! We are a Japanese music band named "Kaneaiyoyoka" which consists of a family.

Our third CD album will be released next May.

We aim to produce the best CD ever in collaboration with various professional musicians. 

To make it, please give me your support for the production cost !

We mainly play our original music composed by ourselves.

We practice every day imaging the stage performances which make you smile.

It is steady and hard work but joyful.

I am refreshing Happiness to make music and performing on the same stage with my children.

 

Introduction of Yoyoka, my daughter

It was only 2 years old when she began playing the drums.

At age 4, she started performing at concerts.

Kaneaiyoyoka was formed when she was 5 years old.

During she was enrolled in kindergarten, at age 6, we recorded and released our 1st CD.

She has been often covered by the media, such as news paper, TV,  and radio.

She experienced more than 100 stage performances.

Her videos of playing the drums was spread to many countries through Youtube and Facebook.

This led to receiving many offers of playing with professional musicians and stage performances.

 

Yoyoka is only 8 years old but practices every day aiming to be the best drummer in the world.  

↑ This photo is of Yoyoka when she started playing the drums, at age 2.

 

As a remarkable characteristic, all members can compose music, write lyrics and perform as vocalists.

In our new album, we will record a number which was made by Yoyoka .

And she will sing that song  as lead vocalist with playing the drums.

Please watch a music video "Sence!" which is the title number recorded in our 2nd CD "Sence!".

 

Various professional music arrangers will also join in our new CD album.

In this album, Jun Abe, a keyboard player, will participate as arranger.

He works for a young drummer Senri Yamaguchi who was chosen as one of the 500 top drummers of the world by "Drummer World", worldwide website about drums.

Besides him, various talented musicians and engineers will join to make the album at a professional grade recording studio.

↑In July 2017, at Sapporo, Yoyoka performed with Jun Abe on the stage of "Special Session" which was organized by Nozomu Kumagai, professional bass guitar player.

 

The cost for produce the new CD album.

We will use the funding for producing the best qualified CD album.

This below is an approximate estimate to produce it ( consists of 5 or 6 songs).

■The cost for recording studio; about 400,000yen
■The cost for mix mastering; about 200,000yen
■Rewards for guest mucisians; about 200,000yen
■Rewards for the designer of CD jacket; about 50,000yen
■The cost for pressing 1,000 CDs; about 150,000yen
Total cost; about 1000,000yen

Could you please making our dreams come true by supporting us?

It is our pleasure if you support half of the cost, 500,000yen.

 

Stretch Goal 

If we could receive more than 500,000 yen, we will do these below as return.

■If we get 600,000 yen of funds, we will make a music video.

We would like to make a music video with a story so that you can enjoy both music and image.

 

■If we get 2000,000 yen of funds, we will have a concert abroad as a memory of releasing the CD.

We will go to the country which donate us most and have the concert !

 

At the last...

Yoyoka and Kaneaiyoyoka will grow more and go for it ! !

We would like to make our first dream in 2018 come true with you.

Please give me your support ! !

※When you help me in Japanese, please look at the Motion Gallery website.
日本語での支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。

MotionGallery web site【8歳ドラマー“よよか”の家族バンド『かねあいよよか』新作CDを最高の作品に！！】

story:
Short Summary

We have been playing together for about 4 years but we could not release our debut album yet. We have the songs composed and we also have a conception about about our first album, but unfortunately we don't have enough money to release it yet. It would be very kind of you if you could help us achieve this goal and we guarantee that you would not regret it!

What We Need & What We Offer

We are in need of $1,500 (dollar), since recording our songs in a studio is very expensive. With your help we could release our full album. We are giving away free CDs to our supporters, what's more, we will give concerts and other surprises to those who help us, depending on the amount of donation.

Other Ways You Can Help Us

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary
We have been playing together for about 4 years but we could not release our debut album yet. We have the songs composed and we also have a conception about about our first album, but unfortunately we don't have enough money to release it yet. It would be very kind of you if you could help us achieve this goal and we guarantee that you would not regret it!

What We Need & What We Offer
We are in need of $1,500 (dollar), since recording our songs in a studio is very expensive. With your help we could release our full album. We are giving away free CDs to our supporters, what's more, we will give concerts and other surprises to those who help us, depending on the amount of donation.

Other Ways You Can Help Us

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Planets are aligning, again...

Mark Nguyen and Juan Andres Lizarazo (Juanlizh) are the songwriting duo known as When Planets Align.  Like Jupiter and Saturn, planets are aligning again as they prepare to release their latest album with the title track arriving on January 21, 2021.

"The Death of Us" album

The title of the album may sound grim.  After all, it is inspired by a real tale of heartache and grief.

Juan's dramatic melodies and Mark's vivid lyrics together convey emotions and feelings of catharsis that many of us have experienced before whatever the loss.  We learn, grow and let go.

Universal emotions

Given the pandemic, many of us can relate to loss and the lives we used to know...

"Weep, grieve and mourn, the death of us, what we had and knew" (from "The Death of Us")

As romance and life itself is impermanent...

"Our plans, reality now shattered by impulse, You said, without warning, we’ve run our course" (from "Validation")

But through loss there is growth...

"Still a chance or hope we can learn and grow? Or is this just a stepping stone?" (from "Stepping Stone")

Producing music during a pandemic

We have self-funded the production of the album in 2019-2020 and encountered recording delays due to the pandemic.  We managed to finish the production in recording studios in Bogota and Los Angeles and the final backing vocals from home (thanks Gabe & Shalini!)

The incredible vocalists who expressed these stories are Boogiewhip, Diego Garcia, Shalini Varghese and Gabe Kubanda along with a talented group of studio musicians.

Special thanks to producers Federico Perez and Sergio Martinez in Bogota, with support from Joshua "Cartier" Cutsinger in Los Angeles.

Support with promotion

We are seeking support to raise awareness for the album as its release alone will likely have limited impact without promotion.  We anticipate the promotional efforts will cost around $5000. 

However, your support is also welcome without money and we completely understand given the challenging times.  Here are some ways you can help:

  • Pre-Save or pre-order the song on Spotify, Apple Music and online before January 21, 2021.  You can find us at When Planets Align on Spotify/Apple or @wpamusic on Instagram and the Pre-Save link:  https://ffm.to/zdkqoy0
  • Donate only if you are in a position to support

Gracias!  We are truly grateful for your support and please stay safe!

story:
Introduction to Moi

Hi! I am Rivita, if you've already met me then you know that I am a very hands on DIY person and I've been making music by myself for many years now and you probably know me because of music in the first place! 

If you don't know me then let me quickly introduce myself. I have been making music since I was a kid, music has always been my number one best friend. When I was 20 years old, I finally got the opportunity to study music full time - this led me to London where I spent 4 years getting my Bachelors and then a Masters degree in Music. 

After graduating, I went back home and spent an year just writing and releasing music. One of my music video, "Listen", went onto get nominated at various film festivals, this gave me a lot of confidence and I decided that maybe I should study a bit more. 

I was awarded a Scholarship to study at Syracuse University, where I studied more about audio and video production. After finishing that program, I decided to put a pin in getting a Doctorate and wanted to focus on being an artist + producer. 

Since then, I have continued to release music and videos with a lot of help from family and friends. Slowly, I'm growing as an artist, producer and composer. 

Today, as I write this, I have written a lot of songs that now need to be produced, it is my dream to release an album and to be able to release a new song every 4 to 6 weeks to build momentum. 

Through this campaign, you will be contributing towards the fees I pay to my publicist who shares my music with radio presenters, to the mastering engineer who polishes the music, to a photographer, videographer and retouch artist who will help me with the artwork, to the musicians who perform on my songs and for the equipment I need to record and deliver my music. 

This campaign is important to me because I believe everyone deserves to live their dream and do what they love without having to worry about money or resources. I like working with other people and when someone performs on my songs, it makes the songs more special and beautiful, having said that I want to be able to pay the people I work with. 

This is my first time asking for money for my music from you, my friends and followers - and I do so because over the years, I've come to respect the art and craft of making music more, I believe that if I can make the music I want and keep it going, then other girls can too. In such a conquest, every penny counts and is more precious than any amount of wealth in this world. 

I leave you with these thoughts and I want to thank you for your contribution in the making of my music! <3 

 

What I need & What's in it for you: 

  • How much funding I need and where it is going? As you are aware I am a DIY artist and I produce, record and mix my own music, this means that I usually end up spending money on equipment. Some of the plugins I use, now come with subscription models (plugins are like apps) and I spend around $50 per month. I will hire session musicians, usually I hire guitarists, drummers and bass players, and they cost anywhere between $50 to $400 depending on their experience. I pay for publicity, a good publicist costs around $2000 per campaign. I will pay for mastering of the songs, my budget is $225 per song. 
  • For every contribution you make, I will be giving you something - you can get a digital download of my song, stickers, CDs and merchandize, a music lesson, hand written lyrics. 
  • If I don't reach my goal, I am still making music on on-going basis, and I will still use whatever money I raise through this campaign towards making new music. The more money I raise, the more music I get to make and vice verse! 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • You must ask why is my project valuable? Ever since I have ventured out into the world and started making music, I realized I don't quite fit in. I'm a 4'10" tall girl from India (sometimes when I go to a networking event, I have to jump up and wave at someone so that they'd see me). For many years and even still, I felt very strange saying I am a musician, and even now that I am somewhat "established" I get a eye-roll or I get asked if I teach singing. But actually, there's much more to what I do, I am a trained professional, I understand microphones and bit-rates, I write, record, arrange, compose, produce and have a vision for the project before it is executed. I budget, I pay people, I fight over little details (!). Did you know, there are only 2% women producers out in the world? WHAAAT!? 
  • I have been making music for 10 years now, with every release I have moved a little forward, when I released my first song in 2014, I could have never imaged that 5 years later I will be on BBC London and Rolling Stone Magazine. I truly believe that the more music I make, the more I learn and the more I am in a position to not only contribute to my own artist project but also to others. 
  • I have received e-mails from teenage girls in Brazil who look up to me because I self-release and I am head strong. As I write this, I think about myself when I was 12 years old, wondering how do I put chords to the melodies inside my head. Over the years, I had more and more questions and to this day, I sit and read books trying to figure out the answer. Today, my question is how does a girl pay for the album that she wants to create and find all the right people who would help her pave the way. By being a part of my project, you're also telling every girl out there, whether she is in India, Brazil, South Africa, Argentina, or the United States that no dream is too big and there is always someone out there listening.

Risks & Challenges

The number one risk is that sometimes, I hire someone and they do not deliver the quality that I like or I just don't agree with their work. Often times, in these cases, I would try to ask for a refund since I won't be using their service. If that is not possible and I do end up paying for the service - then I have to find an alternative way to finish their task, I would then ask someone to help me or I would try to do it myself. 

The other risk is that I make music and I release it and I am not able to re-coup the money I invested in the project. This is the true risk of any artistic project, the bright side of this is that I spent months learning and building relationships and it will 100% pay in the long term in terms in terms of my growth not only as an artist but also as an individual. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, you can still help!

  • First of all, the number one way of helping me is by listening to my music - I am on Spotify + Youtube + Apple Music, you name it.. so even if you cannot add $ to my dreams, you can add some <3 to them!
  • Please share this campaign and my music with your friends + family!
  • Indiegogo has brilliant share tools, just hit share and post this campaign on your social media.

Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
Sumário

Somos um grupo de beatboxers de Portugal
Necessitamos da vossa ajuda para manter o Beatbox vivo em Portugal
Todos os contributos serão cruciais para a realização do evento.

De que necessitamos?

Fundos para sustentar os custos com o sistema de som e luz, licenciamento e prémios para os participantes
Precisamos de manter o Beatbox vivo em Portugal com este tipo de eventos, oferecendo a novos talentos um espaço onde possam mostrar o seu potencial e onde exista a possibilidade de se mostrar e, simultaneamente, entreter o público com algo diferente
Cada donativo é importante para alcançarmos o nosso objetivo. Se não o conseguirmos, iremos aplicar o montante adquirido onde mais precisarmos para que o evento se torne uma realidade.

O impacto

Para além do impacto na comunidade Portuguesa de Beatbox, este evento também terá impacto nas nossas vidas: primeiro, devido ao sentido de dever cumprido, pois todos nós gostamos de atingir os nossos objetivos; em segundo, com este evento estaremos a adquirir aptidões que de outra forma não adquiriríamos.
O Beatbox é uma paixão para nós, uma arte vasta, com possibilidades ilimitadas e oceanos de conhecimento para explorar. Este evento, à semelhança de outros eventos de Beatbox, terá um impacto enorme na exploração e evolução do Beatbox em Portugal.

Outras formas de ajudar

Partilhem esta campanha com os vossos familiares, amigos e conhecidos!

Por agora é tudo. Obrigado a todos!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Help us keep the Portuguese Beatbox Scene alive! This campaign has one single goal: to help us with the expenses inherent to a live Beatbox competition. We need funds to cover expenses related to sound and light equipment, licensing, and awards for the participants.

We will have a National competition so we can crown a new Portuguese beatbox champion so that he/she can represent Portugal in the 2020 Beatbox World Championship.

We thank you in advance, whether you contribute, share, or give us a minute of your time to check this campaign.

Short Summary

We are a group of beatboxers from Portugal
We need help to maintain the Portuguese Beatbox Scene alive
The contributors help will be essential for the event to happen.

What We Need

Funds to support our expenses with sound and light equipment, licensing, and prizes for the participants
The Portuguese Beatbox Community has so much quality to offer the world of beatboxing, we cannot let it die. We need to continue with these yearly beatbox competitions so that new talents have a space to showcase their skills, and, at the same time, to offer a different form of musical entertainment to the public, allowing us to spread this art form.
Every single coin is important to reach our goal. But, if we don’t reach it, we are going to apply the funds where we most need to make the event happen.

The Impact

Besides the impact in the Portuguese Beatbox scene and in the Portuguese Cultural landscape, it also impacts our lives: firstly, with the sensation of fulfilment, because it is always great to accomplish our goals; secondly, this type of event planning will help us develop soft skills that will be useful in future events.
Beatbox is a passion to us, a limitless art form with endless possibilities and oceans of knowledge to be explored. This event, just like every Beatbox event, will have a tremendous impact in the exploration of human beatboxing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise for this campaign! 

And that is all there is to it. Thank you all!

story:
Just another radio station? Definitely NOT!

Local radio in the UK has changed over the past 10 years.  After a series of mergers, acquisitions and takeovers it seems the idea of a local radio station all the family can enjoy are gone - and that's why we are here!

Broadcasting 24 hours a day and available on your phone, tablet, laptop or desktop - and with a very familiar name - Trent Sound is set to launch on Monday 04 March 2019 as a truly localised station for Nottingham.  We are a not-for-profit social enterprise, with every penny re-invested in the service - but we need your help to get the project up and running!

Our exciting station will target the 40+ audience, harnessing the latest technologies to deliver a vibrant localised radio station with a mix of music, news, sport, weather, travel, community information - everything that Radio Trent offered but now re-invented for 2019.

You can listen to our test transmissions via the webrad.io website - just click here.

 

What We Need & What We Can Offer:

We need to raise £6,500 to launch the station.  Much of the preparatory work has already been done. We have trademarked the name, test transmissions are underway via our website, the studio is built and some presenters have been found.  If we can't raise all of the money in this crowd funding bid, we plan to run again minus whatever we have raised.  Provided the vital licence fees can be covered we are guaranteed to launch on time even if it has to be a limited service.

The funding we seek will allow us to operate for two years, by which time we will have won an audience and be able to sell advertising to fund our future plans to broadcast as a DAB station. 

In return for your support we have put together some reward packages which we think will be of interest and ensure that Trent Sound really rocks!  Parts of our reward scheme includes advertising on our website as banner ads, programme feature sponsorship and conventional radio advertisements - so for the first year in order to honour these commitments we will not actively try to sell more.

We have produced a multi-page document which details the entire ILR project in some detail, if you want to read it you'll be able to download a *.pdf version here. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you want to support Trent Sound but can't afford to help financially, we would certainly love to hear from you.  If you'd like more information you can email info@trentsound.net, contact us via our Facebook page or call us on 0330 043 5705 (Monday-Friday 09:00-17:00).
